docs.title: Basic method
docs.text:
\[ oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1} = oldsymbol{x}_k - t_k abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \]

\(- abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\) is the direction of fastest rate of decrease of \(f\) at \( oldsymbol{x}_k\):

Proof

If \(\lVert oldsymbol{d}_k Vert_2 = 1\),

\[ \lim_{t o 0} rac{ f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}_k + t\, oldsymbol{d}_k) }{t} = -\, oldsymbol{d}_k^{T} abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \leq\lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert_2 \]

with equality iff \(\displaystyle oldsymbol{d}_k= - rac{ abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) }{ \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert_2 }\)

Lipschitz Continuity

A function \( oldsymbol{f}: \mathbb{R}^n o \mathbb{R}^m\) is Lipschitz continuous iff there exists a constant \(C > 0\) s.t.

\[ \Vert oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{x}) - oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{y}) \Vert \leq C \Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y} \Vert \]

Examples

\( oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{x}) = oldsymbol{Qx}\) is \(\sigma_ ext{max}( oldsymbol{Q})\)-Lipschitz: Let \( oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y} = oldsymbol{d}\),

\[ \Vert oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{x}) - oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{y}) \Vert^2 = oldsymbol{d}^T oldsymbol{Q}^T oldsymbol{Q} oldsymbol{d} \leq \lambda_ ext{max}( oldsymbol{Q}^T oldsymbol{Q})\Vert oldsymbol{d} \Vert^2 \]

\(L\)-smoothness

A function is \(L\)-smooth if it is differentiable and ist gradiend is \(L\)-Lipschitz, i.e.

\[ \Vert abla oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{x}) - abla oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{y}) \Vert \leq C \Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y} \Vert \]

Examples

\(f( oldsymbol{x}) = oldsymbol{x}^T oldsymbol{Q} oldsymbol{x}\) with \( oldsymbol{Q} \succeq oldsymbol{O}\) is \(\sigma_ ext{max}( oldsymbol{Q})\)-smooth.

A twice continuously differentiable convex \(f: \mathbb{R}^n o \mathbb{R}\) is \(L\)-smooth iff

\[ abla^2f( oldsymbol{x}) \preceq L oldsymbol{I} \Leftrightarrow \lambda_ ext{max}( abla^2f( oldsymbol{x})) \leq L \]

docs.title: Quadratic upper bound
docs.text:
If \(f\) is \(L\)-smooth, then

\[ f( oldsymbol{y}) \leq f( oldsymbol{x}) + abla f( oldsymbol{x})^T( oldsymbol{y} - oldsymbol{x}) + rac{L}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{y} - oldsymbol{x}\Vert^2 \]

Proof

First prove the 1D case. Let \(g(t)\) be \(L_g\)-smooth, \(\lvert g'(t)-g'(s) vert\le L_g\lvert t-s vert\).

\[ egin{aligned} g(1) &= g(0)+\int_{0}^{1} g'(t)\mathrm{d}t \ &= g(0)+g'(0)+\int_{0}^{1} igl[g'(t)-g'(0) igr]\mathrm{d}t \ &\leq g(0)+g'(0)+\int_{0}^{1}L_g t\mathrm{d}t \quad ext{since }\lvert g'(t)-g'(0) vert\leq L_g t \ &= g(0)+g'(0)+ rac12 L_g \end{aligned} \]

For the general case, apply the above to \(g(t)=f( oldsymbol{x}+t oldsymbol{d})\) with \( oldsymbol{d}= oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x}\) and \(L_g = L \lVert oldsymbol{d} Vert^{2}\). To check the smoothness of \(g\),

\[ egin{aligned} \lvert g'(t)-g'(s) vert &= igl\lvert [ abla f( oldsymbol{x}+t oldsymbol{d}) - abla f( oldsymbol{x}+s oldsymbol{d})]^T oldsymbol{d} igr vert \ &\le \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}+t oldsymbol{d}) - abla f( oldsymbol{x}+s oldsymbol{d}) Vert \lVert oldsymbol{d} Vert \quad& ext{Cauchy--Schwarz} \ &\le (t-s) L \lVert oldsymbol{d} Vert^{2} \quad &f ext{ is $L$-smooth}. \end{aligned} \]

Consequence of quadratic upper bound

For \(L\)-smooth \(f\), the sequence \(\{ oldsymbol{x}_k\}\) produced by gradient descent satisfies:

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1}) \leq f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - t\left(1 - rac{L}{2}t ight) \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \Vert^2 \]

Proof

Using the theorem above and \( abla f( oldsymbol{x})^T( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1} - oldsymbol{x}_k) = - t \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \Vert^2\).

i.e.

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_{k}) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1}) \geq t\left(1 - rac{L}{2}t ight) \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \Vert^2 \geq rac{1}{2}t \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \Vert^2 \]

if \(\displaystyle 0 \leq t \leq rac{1}{L}\) (Descent Lemma)

Convergence Analysis

If step size \(t \in (0, 1 / L]\), and \( oldsymbol{x}^*\) is a minimum of \(f\), then

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq rac{\Vert oldsymbol{x}_0 - oldsymbol{x}^*\Vert^2}{2tk} \]

Notes

\(f(x) o f^*\) as \(k o \infty\) Any limiting point of \( oldsymbol{x}_k\) is an optimal solution The rate of convergence if \(O(1/k)\), i.e. number of iterations to guarantee \(f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f^* \leq \varepsilon\) is \(O(1 / \varepsilon)\), exponential! Faster convergence with larger \(t\); best \(t = 1 / L\), but \(L\) is unknown

Proof

\[ egin{aligned} \| oldsymbol{x}_{k+1} - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 - \| oldsymbol{x}_k - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 &= \| oldsymbol{x}_k - t abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 - \| oldsymbol{x}_k - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 \ &= 2t abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)^T ( oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_k) + t^2 \| abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\|^2 \ & \leq 2t igl[f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{x}_k) igr] + 2t igl[f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr] \ &= 2t igl[f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr] \ \end{aligned} \]

Sum over \(k\) from \(0\) to \(N-1\),

\[ egin{aligned} \| oldsymbol{x}_N - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 - \| oldsymbol{x}_0 - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 &\leq 2t \sum_{k=0}^{N-1} igl[f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr] \ &\leq 2tN igl[f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{x}_N) igr] \end{aligned} \]

So

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_N) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \le rac{\| oldsymbol{x}_0 - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2}{2tN} \]

docs.title: Gradient Flow
docs.text:
A continuous version of gradient descent.

\[ \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}s}\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s = -\nabla f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s) \]

at time \(s\).

We also have:

If \(f\) is convex and \(\boldsymbol{x}^*\) is the minimum of \(f\)

\[ f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_T) - f(\boldsymbol{x}^*) \le \frac{\|\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_0 - \boldsymbol{x}^*\|^2}{2T} \]

at time \(T\)

Proof

\[ \begin{aligned} \frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm ds}\|\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s - \boldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 &= 2\langle \tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s - \boldsymbol{x}^*, \frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm ds}\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s\rangle = 2\langle \nabla f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s), \boldsymbol{x}^* - \tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s\rangle \\ &\leq 2\bigl(f(\boldsymbol{x}^*) - f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s)\bigr) \end{aligned} \]

Integrating from \(0\) to \(T\) and using \(f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s) \ge f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_T)\),

\[ \begin{aligned} \|\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_T - \boldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 - \|\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_0 - \boldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 &\leq \int_0^T 2\bigl(f(\boldsymbol{x}^*) - f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s)\bigr)\mathrm ds \\ &\leq 2T\bigl(f(\boldsymbol{x}^*) - f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_T)\bigr) \end{aligned} \]

docs.title: Strong Convexity
docs.text:
A function \(f\) is strongly convex with parameter \(m > 0\), or simply \(m\)-strongly convex, if

\[ \tilde{f}(\boldsymbol{x}) = f(\boldsymbol{x}) - \frac{m}{2}\Vert \boldsymbol{x}\Vert^2 \]

is convex.

docs.title: First order condition for strongly convex
docs.text:
A differentiable \(f\) is \(m\)-strongly convex iff.

\[ f( oldsymbol{y})\geq f( oldsymbol{x}) + abla f( oldsymbol{x})^T( oldsymbol{y} - oldsymbol{x}) + rac{m}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y}\Vert^2 \]

Proof

\[ egin{aligned} f( oldsymbol{y}) &\ge f( oldsymbol{x}) + abla f( oldsymbol{x})^{\!T}( oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x}) + rac{m}{2} igl(\| oldsymbol{y}\|^2-\| oldsymbol{x}\|^2 igr) - m oldsymbol{x}^{T}( oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x}) \ &= f( oldsymbol{x}) + abla f( oldsymbol{x})^{\!T}( oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x}) + rac{m}{2}\| oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x}\|^2, \end{aligned} \]

docs.title: Second order condition for strongly convex
docs.text:
A twice differentiable \(f\) is \(m\)-strongly convex iff.

\[ abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x}) \succeq m oldsymbol{I} \Longleftrightarrow \lambda_{ ext{min}}( abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x})) \geq m \]

The bound of the strongly convex function

\(m\)-strong convexity and \(L\)-smoothness together imply

\[ rac{m}{2}\,\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{y}\|^{2}\leq f( oldsymbol{y})-f( oldsymbol{x})- abla f( oldsymbol{x})^{T}( oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x})\leq rac{L}{2}\,\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{y}\|^{2} \]

i.e. (more precisely)

\[ egin{aligned} rac{1}{2}\lambda_{ ext{min}}( abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x}))\,\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{y}\|^{2}&\leq f( oldsymbol{y})-f( oldsymbol{x})- abla f( oldsymbol{x})^{T}( oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x})\&\leq rac{1}{2}\lambda_{ ext{max}}( abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x}))\,\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{y}\|^{2} \end{aligned} \]

If \(f\) is \(m\)-strongly convex, then

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq rac{1}{2m}\Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}) \Vert^2 \]

Proof

\[ egin{aligned} f( oldsymbol{x}^*) &= \min_{ oldsymbol{y}}f( oldsymbol{y}) \geq \min_{ oldsymbol{y}} f( oldsymbol{x}) + abla f( oldsymbol{x})^T( oldsymbol{y} - oldsymbol{x}) + rac{m}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y}\Vert^2 \ &\geq f( oldsymbol{x}) - rac{1}{2m}\Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x})\Vert^2\qquad \left( ext{Let }y = oldsymbol{x} - rac{1}{m} abla f( oldsymbol{x}) ight) \end{aligned} \]

docs.title: The convergence of strongly convex in gradient flow
docs.text:
In this case we can know that

\[ egin{aligned} rac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}s}\,\| oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} &= 2\langle oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s}- oldsymbol{x}^*,\, rac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}s} oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s} angle \ &= 2\left\langle abla f( oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s}),\, oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s} ight angle \ &\le 2 igl[f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s}) igr] - rac{m}{2}\| oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} \ &\le -m\| oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2}. \end{aligned} \]

Then

\[ \Vert ilde{ oldsymbol{x}}_T - oldsymbol{x}^*\Vert^2 \leq \mathrm{e}^{-mT}\Vert ilde{ oldsymbol{x}}_0 - oldsymbol{x}^*\Vert^2 \]

The inequality

\[ egin{aligned} \displaystyle rac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}x}f(x) \leq Cf(x) &\Leftrightarrow [\mathrm{e}^{Cx} f(x)]' \leq 0 \Leftrightarrow \mathrm{e}^{Cx}f(x) \leq f(0) \ &\Leftrightarrow f(x) \leq \mathrm{e}^{-Cx}f(0) \end{aligned} \]

Theorem: If \(f\) is \(m\)-strongly convex and \(L\)-smooth, and \( oldsymbol{x}^*\) is a minimum of \(f\), then for step size \(\displaystyle t \in (1, 1/L]\), the sequence \({ oldsymbol{x}_k}\) produced by the gradient descent algorithm satisfies:

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k)-f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \le (1-mt)^{k} igl[f( oldsymbol{x}_0)-f( oldsymbol{x}^*) igr] \] \[ \| oldsymbol{x}_k- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} \le (1-mt)^{k}\| oldsymbol{x}_0- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2}. \]

Notes

The number of iterations to reach \(f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq \varepsilon\) is \(O(\log (1 / \varepsilon))\), linear in the number of significant digits! And the bound yield:

\[ rac{m}{2}\,\| oldsymbol{x}_k- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2}\leq f( oldsymbol{x}_k)-f( oldsymbol{x}^*)\leq rac{L}{2}\,\| oldsymbol{x}_k- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} \]

Proof

Similarly

\[ egin{aligned} \| oldsymbol{x}_{k+1} - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 - \| oldsymbol{x}_k - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 &= 2t abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)^T ( oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_k) + t^2 \| abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\|^2 \ \end{aligned} \]

this time, we have

\[ abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)^{T}( oldsymbol{x}^*- oldsymbol{x}_k) \le f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - rac{m}{2}\| oldsymbol{x}_k- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} \]

So

\[ egin{aligned} \| oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} &\le (1-mt)\| oldsymbol{x}_{k}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} + 2t igl[f( oldsymbol{x}^*)-f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr] \ &\le (1-mt)\| oldsymbol{x}_{k}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} \end{aligned} \]

By \(L\)-smoothness,

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1}) \geq rac{t}{2}\Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\Vert^2 \]

By \(m\)-strong convexity,

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq rac{1}{2m}\Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\Vert^2 \]

eliminate \(\Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\Vert^2\), we get

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1}) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq (1 - mt)[f( oldsymbol{x}_{k}) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*)] \]

docs.title: Condition number and Enhanced methods
docs.text: For a quadratic function \(\displaystyle f(\boldsymbol{x}) = \frac{1}{2}\boldsymbol{x}^T\boldsymbol{Qx}\), we introduce a number to depict its converging speed: Condition number

docs.title: Condition number
docs.text:
For a matrix \(\boldsymbol{Q} \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times n}\) s.t. \(\boldsymbol{Q} \succeq \boldsymbol{O}\), its condition number is defined as

\[ \kappa(\boldsymbol{Q}) = \frac{\lambda_{\text{max}}(\boldsymbol{Q})}{\lambda_{\text{min}}(\boldsymbol{Q})} \]

It characterizes how stretched the level curves of \(\displaystyle f(\boldsymbol{x}) = \frac{1}{2}\boldsymbol{x}^T\boldsymbol{Qx}\) are. For nonquadratic case, \(\kappa(\nabla^2 f(\boldsymbol{x}))\) plays a similar role.

A problem \(\displaystyle \min_{\boldsymbol{x}}\frac{1}{2}\boldsymbol{x}^T\boldsymbol{Qx}\) is well conditioned if \(\kappa(\boldsymbol{Q})\) is small. Or it is ill conditioned.

docs.title: Exact line search
docs.text:
Let \(\displaystyle t_k = \arg\min_s f(\boldsymbol{x}_k - s\nabla f(\boldsymbol{x}_k))\) in each step! In practice it is expensive!

Examples

It does not guarantee a fast convergence!

Convergence analysis

\[ f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)-f(\boldsymbol{x}^*) \le \left(1-\frac{m}{L}\right)^{k} \bigl[f(\boldsymbol{x}_0)-f(\boldsymbol{x}^*)\bigr] \]

Proof omitted for its similar as before.

docs.title: Backtracking ling search
docs.text:
Let \(\alpha, eta \in (0, 1)\) are constants, and in each step, do

\[ t \gets eta t \]

until

\[ f( oldsymbol{x} - t abla f( oldsymbol{x})) \leq f( oldsymbol{x}) - \alpha t \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x})\Vert^2 \]

(Armijo’s rule)

Noting

For general \( oldsymbol{d}\), use \(f( oldsymbol{x} + t oldsymbol{d}) > f( oldsymbol{x}) + \alpha t abla f( oldsymbol{x})^T oldsymbol{d}\)

In this image, \(t_2\) is acceptable.

However, it still converges slow in ill-conditioned cases.

Convergence Analysis

The sequence \(\{ oldsymbol{x}_k\}\) satisfies:

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq c^k[f( oldsymbol{x}_0) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*)] \]

where

\[ c = 1 - \min \left\{2m\alpha t_0, rac{4m eta \alpha (1 - \alpha)}{L} ight\} \]

Proof

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k - t abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)) \le f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - t \left(1 - rac{L t}{2} ight) \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert^2 \]

The inner loop terminates for sure if (not sufficient)

\[ - t \left(1 - rac{L t}{2} ight) \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert^2 \le - \alpha t \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert^2 \Longrightarrow t \le rac{2(1-\alpha)}{L} \]

and the former iteration doesn't terminate,

\[ t_{k - 1} > rac{2(1-\alpha)}{L} \Longrightarrow t_k > rac{2 eta(1-\alpha)}{L} \]

i.e.

\[ t_k \ge \eta riangleq \min \left\{ t_0,\ rac{2 eta(1-\alpha)}{L} ight\} \]

Then

\[ egin{aligned} f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) - f(x^*) &\leq f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f(x^*) - \alpha t_k \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert^2 \ &\le f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f(x^*) - \alpha \eta \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert^2 \ \Longleftrightarrow & \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert^2 \ge 2m igl[f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f(x^*) igr] \end{aligned} \]

Eliminate \(\lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert^2\) and we get

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f(x^*) \le c^k igl[f( oldsymbol{x}_0) - f(x^*) igr] \]

docs.title: Newton's method
docs.text:
Do better with second order derivative

Step \( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1} = oldsymbol{x}_k - t_k abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\) can be interpreted as minimizing a quadratic approximation:

\[ egin{aligned} \hat{f}_{\mathrm{gd}}( oldsymbol{x}) & riangleq f( oldsymbol{x}_k) + abla f( oldsymbol{x})^T( oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k) + rac{1}{2t_k}\Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k \Vert^2 \ &= rac{1}{2t_k}\left\Vert oldsymbol{x} - ( oldsymbol{x}_k - t_k abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)) ight\Vert_2^2 \end{aligned} \]

And Newton's method minimizes the second-order Taylor approximation

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}) \approx \hat{f}_{\mathrm{nt}}( oldsymbol{x}) riangleq f( oldsymbol{x}_k) + abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)^{T} ( oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k) + rac{1}{2} ( oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k)^{T} abla^{2} f( oldsymbol{x}_k) ( oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k) \]

So assuming \( abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \succ oldsymbol{O}\)

\[ oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1} = oldsymbol{x}_k - igl[ abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x}_k) igr]^{-1} abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \]

Stop criterion

\(\Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) > 0\Vert > \delta\) or in practice \( abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)^T igl[ abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x}_k) igr]^{-1} > \delta\)

docs.title: Affine invariance
docs.text:
Do Newton's method on the two end of a affine transformation, you will get the same sequence (after transform).

Given \(f\) and a invertible \(\boldsymbol{A}\), let \(g(\boldsymbol{y}) = f(\boldsymbol{Ay})\),

\[ \nabla g(\boldsymbol{y}) = \boldsymbol{A}^{T} \nabla f(\boldsymbol{A} \boldsymbol{y}), \quad \nabla^{2} g(\boldsymbol{y}) = \boldsymbol{A}^{T} \nabla^{2} f(\boldsymbol{A} \boldsymbol{y}) \boldsymbol{A} \]

If \(\boldsymbol{x}_0 = \boldsymbol{Ay}_0\), then

\[ \begin{aligned} \boldsymbol{y}_1 &= \boldsymbol{y}_0 - \bigl[\nabla^{2} g(\boldsymbol{y}_0)\bigr]^{-1} \nabla g(\boldsymbol{y}_0) \\ &= \boldsymbol{y}_0 - \bigl[\boldsymbol{A}^{T} \nabla^{2} f(\boldsymbol{x}_0) \boldsymbol{A}\bigr]^{-1} \boldsymbol{A}^{T} \nabla f(\boldsymbol{x}_0) \\ &= \boldsymbol{y}_0 - \boldsymbol{A}^{-1} \bigl[\nabla^{2} f(\boldsymbol{x}_0)\bigr]^{-1} \nabla f(\boldsymbol{x}_0) \\ &= \boldsymbol{A}^{-1} \bigl[\boldsymbol{x}_0 - \bigl[\nabla^{2} f(\boldsymbol{x}_0)\bigr]^{-1} \nabla f(\boldsymbol{x}_0)\bigr] \\ &= \boldsymbol{A}^{-1} \boldsymbol{x}_1 \end{aligned} \]

Connection to root finding

Finding the minimum is equal to find the root of its derivative!

It converges fast!

Convergence Analysis: 1D case first

In general, Newton’s method does not guarantee global convergence. When it does converge, the convergence is usually very fast.

If \(f\) is \(m\)-strongly convex and \(f''\) is \(M\)-Lipschitz, then

\[ |x_{k + 1} - x^*| \leq \frac{M}{2m}|x_k - x^*|^2 \]

Let \(\displaystyle\xi_k = \frac{M}{2m}|x_k - x^*|\), it converges iff. \(\xi_0 < 1\), and it takes \(O(\log \log \frac{1}{\varepsilon})\) to convergence!

Proof

\[ \begin{aligned} \lvert x_{k+1} - x^{*} \rvert &= \lvert x_k - x^{*} - \bigl[f''(x_k)\bigr]^{-1} f'(x_k) \rvert \\[4pt] &= \lvert f''(x_k)\rvert^{-1} \cdot \lvert f'(x^{*}) - f'(x_k) - f''(x_k)(x^{*} - x_k) \rvert \qquad & f'(x^*) = 0 \\[4pt] &= \frac{\lvert x_k - x^{*} \rvert}{\lvert f''(x_k)\rvert} \cdot \left\lvert \int_{0}^{1} \bigl[f''(x_k + t(x^{*} - x_k)) - f''(x_k)\bigr] \,\mathrm{d}t \right\rvert \\[4pt] &\le \frac{\lvert x_k - x^{*} \rvert}{\lvert f''(x_k)\rvert} \cdot \int_{0}^{1} \left\lvert f''(x_k + t(x^{*} - x_k)) - f''(x_k) \right\rvert \mathrm{d}t \qquad & \text{Cauchy-Schwarz} \\[4pt] &\le \frac{\lvert x_k - x^{*} \rvert}{\lvert f''(x_k)\rvert} \cdot \int_{0}^{1} M t \lvert x_k - x^{*} \rvert \mathrm{d}t \qquad& M\text{-Lipschitz} \\[4pt] &= \frac{M}{2 \lvert f''(x_k)\rvert} \lvert x_k - x^{*} \rvert^{2} \\[4pt] &\le \frac{M}{2 m} \lvert x_k - x^{*} \rvert^{2} \qquad& m\text{-strong convexity} \end{aligned} \]

Convergence Analysis: general

If \(f\) is \(m\)-strongly convex and \(\nabla^2 f\) is \(M\)-Lipschitz, \(\boldsymbol{x}^*\) is a minimum of \(f\), then the Newton sequence \(\{\boldsymbol{x}_l\}\) satisfies:

\[ \Vert \boldsymbol{x}_{k + 1} - \boldsymbol{x}^*\Vert \leq \frac{M}{2m}\Vert \boldsymbol{x}_k - \boldsymbol{x}^* \Vert^2 \]

And if \(\displaystyle\Vert \boldsymbol{x}_{0} - \boldsymbol{x}^*\Vert \leq \frac{2m}{M}\), then

\[ \Vert \boldsymbol{x}_k - \boldsymbol{x}^* \Vert \leq \frac{2m}{M}\left(\frac{M}{2m}\Vert \boldsymbol{x}_{0} - \boldsymbol{x}^*\Vert\right)^{2^{k}} \]

Proof

Similarly

Text Only
$$
\begin{aligned}
\|\boldsymbol{x}_{k+1}-\boldsymbol{x}^*\|
&= \|\boldsymbol{x}_k-\boldsymbol{x}^* - [\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)]^{-1}[\nabla f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)-\nabla f(\boldsymbol{x}^*)]\| \\[4pt]
&\le \|[\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)]^{-1}\|\,
    \|\nabla f(\boldsymbol{x}^*)-\nabla f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)-\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)(\boldsymbol{x}^*-\boldsymbol{x}_k)\| \\[4pt]
&= \|[\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)]^{-1}\|\,
\left\|\int_{0}^{1}\left[\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k+t(\boldsymbol{x}^*-\boldsymbol{x}_k))
    -\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)\right](\boldsymbol{x}^*-\boldsymbol{x}_k)\,\mathrm{d}t\right\| \\[4pt]
&\le \|[\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)]^{-1}\|
    \int_{0}^{1}\left\|
        \left[\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k+t(\boldsymbol{x}^*-\boldsymbol{x}_k))
        -\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)\right](\boldsymbol{x}^*-\boldsymbol{x}_k)
    \right\|\mathrm{d}t \\[4pt]
&\le \|[\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)]^{-1}\|
    \int_{0}^{1}
        \left\|
        \nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k+t(\boldsymbol{x}^*-\boldsymbol{x}_k))
        -\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)
        \right\|
        \cdot \|\boldsymbol{x}^*-\boldsymbol{x}_k\|
    \,\mathrm{d}t \\[4pt]
&\le \|[\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)]^{-1}\|
    \int_{0}^{1} Mt\|\boldsymbol{x}^*-\boldsymbol{x}_k\|^{2}\,\mathrm{d}t \\[4pt]
&= \|[\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)]^{-1}\|
    \cdot \frac{M}{2}\|\boldsymbol{x}^*-\boldsymbol{x}_k\|^{2} \\[4pt]
&\le \frac{M}{2m}\|\boldsymbol{x}_k-\boldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2}
\end{aligned}
$$

Last step:

$$
\|[\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)]^{-1}\|
= \lambda_{\max}\!\left([\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)]^{-1}\right)
= \frac{1}{\lambda_{\min}(\nabla^{2}f(\boldsymbol{x}_k))}
\le \frac{1}{m}
$$

docs.title: Damped Newton’s method
docs.text:
Add ratio \(t\) (similar as the \(t\) above) to ensure the convergence.

\[ egin{aligned} & extbf{initialize } oldsymbol{x} \leftarrow oldsymbol{x}_0 \in \mathbb{R}^n \ & extbf{while } \| abla f( oldsymbol{x})\| > \delta extbf{ do} \ &\qquad oldsymbol{d} \leftarrow -[ abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x})]^{-1} abla f( oldsymbol{x}) \ &\qquad t \leftarrow 1 \ &\qquad extbf{while } f( oldsymbol{x}+t oldsymbol{d}) > f( oldsymbol{x}) + \alpha t abla f( oldsymbol{x})^T oldsymbol{d} extbf{ do} \ &\qquad \qquad t \leftarrow eta t \ &\qquad extbf{end while} \ &\qquad oldsymbol{x} \leftarrow oldsymbol{x} + t oldsymbol{d} \ & extbf{end while} \ & extbf{return } oldsymbol{x} \end{aligned} \]

Convergence Analysis

If \(f\) is \(m\)-strongly convex and \(L\)-smooth, and \( abla^2f\) is \(M\)-Lipschitz, then

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k)-f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \le egin{cases} f( oldsymbol{x}_0)-f( oldsymbol{x}^*)-\gamma k, & k \le k_0, \[4pt] \dfrac{2m^{3}}{M^{2}} \left(\dfrac12 ight)^{2^{\,k-k_0+1}}, & k > k_0 , \end{cases} \]

where \(\displaystyle \gamma = rac{2\alpha ar{\alpha} eta \eta^{2} m}{L^{2}}, \eta = \min\{1,\,3(1-2\alpha)\} rac{m^{2}}{M}\) and and \(k_0\) is the number of steps until \(\displaystyle \| abla f( oldsymbol{x}_{k_0+1})\| \le \eta\)

To get \(f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f(x^*) \leq \varepsilon\), we need at most

\[ rac{f( oldsymbol{x}_0) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*)}{\gamma} + \log_2 \log_2 rac{\varepsilon_0}{\varepsilon} \]

where \(\displaystyle \varepsilon_0 = rac{2m^3}{M^2}\), it can be slow if \(\gamma\) is small.

Proof

The convergence follows two stages:

Damped Newton phase: When \(\Vert f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\Vert > \eta\), backtracking selects a step size \(t_k \leq 1\), and so

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1}) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq -\gamma \]

sum:

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{x}_0) \leq -k_0 \gamma \Longrightarrow k_0 \leq rac{f( oldsymbol{x}_0) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*)}{\gamma} \]

Pure Newton phase: When \(\Vert f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\Vert \leq \eta\), backtracking selects a step size \(t_k = 1\) and so

\[ \| abla f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1})\| \le rac{M}{2m^{2}} \| abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\|^{2} \le rac12 \| abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\| \le \eta \]

by induction, \(\| abla f( oldsymbol{x}_{k})\| \leq \eta\) for all \(k > k_0\), to we will stay in the pure Newton phase with \(t_k = 1\)

docs.title: Proximal gradient descent
docs.text:
If we encounter \(f\) like \(f( oldsymbol{x}) = g( oldsymbol{x}) + h( oldsymbol{x})\) where \(g( oldsymbol{x})\) is convex and smooth and \(h( oldsymbol{x})\) is convex but not necessarily smooth.

Example

Linear regression problem

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}) = rac{1}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{y} - oldsymbol{Xw}\Vert_2^2 + \lambda \Vert oldsymbol{w} \Vert_1 \]

Proximal gradient descent uses a similar approximation, but only for the smooth part \(g\):

\[ egin{aligned} \hat{g}_{\mathrm{gd}}( oldsymbol{x}) & riangleq g( oldsymbol{x}_k) + abla g( oldsymbol{x})^T( oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k) + rac{1}{2t_k}\Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k \Vert^2 \ oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1} &= \arg \min_{ oldsymbol{x}}\left\{g( oldsymbol{x}_k) + abla g( oldsymbol{x})^T( oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k) + rac{1}{2t_k}\Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k \Vert^2 + t_k h( oldsymbol{x}) ight\} \ &= \arg \min_{ oldsymbol{x}}\left\{ rac{1}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{x} - ( oldsymbol{x}_k - t_k abla g( oldsymbol{x}_k))\Vert_2^2 + t_k h( oldsymbol{x}) ight\} \end{aligned} \]

Note

"Proximal" means we try to make \( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1}\) stay close to \( oldsymbol{x}_k - t_k abla g( oldsymbol{x}_k)\)

Proximal mapping / operator:

\[ \operatorname{prox}_h( oldsymbol{y}) = \arg \min_{ oldsymbol{x}}\left\{ rac{1}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y} \Vert_2^2 + h( oldsymbol{x}) ight\} \]

so

\[ oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1} = \operatorname{prox}_{t_kh}( oldsymbol{x}_k - t_k abla g( oldsymbol{x}_k)) \]

Note

The proximal operator involves another optimization problem! Fortunately, it depends only on \(h\) not on \(g\), and we can compute it in closed form for many important \(h\) such as \(l_1\) regularizaiton.

Example

When \(\displaystyle h( oldsymbol{x}) = rac{\lambda}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{x}\Vert_2^2\), then

\[ \operatorname{prox}_h( oldsymbol{y}) = rac{ oldsymbol{y}}{1 + \lambda} \]

When \(h( oldsymbol{x}) = \Vert oldsymbol{x}\Vert_1\), then

\[ rac{1}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y} \Vert^2 + \lambda \Vert oldsymbol{x}\Vert_1 = \sum_{i = 1}^n \left[ rac{1}{2}(x_i - y_i)^2 + \lambda \vert x_i \vert ight] \]

so

\[ \left[\operatorname{prox}_{\lambda | \cdot |}( oldsymbol{y}) ight]_i = [\operatorname{sgn}(y_i)(|y_i| - \lambda)^+] = egin{cases} y_i - \lambda, &\quad y_i > \lambda \ 0, &\quad -\lambda \leq y_i \leq \lambda \ y_i + \lambda, &\quad y_i < -\lambda \end{cases} \]

We denote \(S_\lambda = \operatorname{sgn}(y_i)(|y_i| - \lambda)^+\)

docs.title: Lower bound for strongly convex functions
docs.text:
If \(\varphi:\ \Omega o \mathbb{R}\) is \(\mu\)-strongly convex with a minimum \( oldsymbol{x}^*\), then

\[ \varphi( oldsymbol{x}) \ge \varphi( oldsymbol{x}^*) + rac{\mu}{2}\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|_2^2, \quad orall oldsymbol{x}\in\Omega \]

Proof

Since \(\varphi\) is \(\mu\)-strongly convex, there exists a convex \( ilde{\varphi}( oldsymbol{x})\) such that

\[ \varphi( oldsymbol{x}) = ilde{\varphi}( oldsymbol{x}) + rac{\mu}{2}\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|_2^2 \]

Fix \( oldsymbol{x}\) and let \( oldsymbol{x}_t = t oldsymbol{x} + ar{t} oldsymbol{x}^*= oldsymbol{x}^* + t( oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}^*), t\in[0,1]\), then

\[ \varphi( oldsymbol{x}^*) \le \varphi( oldsymbol{x}_t) = ilde{\varphi}( oldsymbol{x}_t) + rac{\mu}{2}\| oldsymbol{x}_t - oldsymbol{x}^*\|_2^2 \le t ilde{\varphi}( oldsymbol{x}) + ar{t} ilde{\varphi}( oldsymbol{x}^*) + rac{\mu t^2}{2}\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|_2^2 \]

Then

\[ ilde{\varphi}( oldsymbol{x}) \ge \varphi( oldsymbol{x}^*) - rac{\mu t}{2}\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|_2^{2},\ orall t\in[0,1] \implies ilde{\varphi}( oldsymbol{x}) \ge \varphi( oldsymbol{x}^*) \]

Convergence Analysis

Let \(f( oldsymbol{x}) = g( oldsymbol{x}) + h( oldsymbol{x})\), where \(h\) is convex, \(g\) is convex and \(L\)-smooth. Let \( oldsymbol{x}^*\) be a minimum of \(f\). For \(t \in (0,\,1/L]\), the sequence \(\{ oldsymbol{x}_k\}\) produced by proximal gradient descent with constant step size \(t\) satisfies \(f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) \le f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\) and

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \le rac{\| oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_0\|_2^{2}}{2tk} \]

If, in addition, \(g\) is \(m\)-strongly convex, then

\[ \| oldsymbol{x}_{k+1} - oldsymbol{x}^*\|_2^{2} \le (1 - mt)\,\| oldsymbol{x}_k - oldsymbol{x}^*\|_2^{2} \]

so

\[ \| oldsymbol{x}_k - oldsymbol{x}^*\|_2^{2} \le (1 - mt)^{k} \| oldsymbol{x}_0 - oldsymbol{x}^*\|_2^{2} \]

Proof

Let \(\displaystyle\hat{f}( oldsymbol{x})= g( oldsymbol{x}_k)+ abla g( oldsymbol{x}_k)^{T}( oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_k)+ rac{1}{2t}\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_k\|_2^2+ h( oldsymbol{x})\). Since Since \(g\) is \(L\)-smooth and \(\displaystyle rac{1}{t} \ge L\), by the quadratic upper bound

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}) \le g( oldsymbol{x}_k) + abla g( oldsymbol{x}_k)^{T}( oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_k) + rac{L}{2}\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_k\|_2^2 + h( oldsymbol{x}) \le \hat{f}( oldsymbol{x}) \]

Since \( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1} = \arg\min_{ oldsymbol{x}} \hat{f}( oldsymbol{x})\) by definition,

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) \le \hat{f}( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) \le \hat{f}( oldsymbol{x}_k) = f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \]

Given

\[ egin{aligned} f( oldsymbol{x}) &\ge g( oldsymbol{x}_k) + abla g( oldsymbol{x}_k)^T( oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_k) + h( oldsymbol{x}) = \hat{f}( oldsymbol{x}) - rac{1}{2t}\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_k\|_2^2 \ \hat{f}( oldsymbol{x}) &\ge \hat{f}( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) + rac{1}{2t}\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}\|_2^2 \qquad ext{Gradient is zero for argmin} \end{aligned} \]

So

\[ \| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}\|_2^2 - \| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_k\|_2^2 \le 2t igl[f( oldsymbol{x}) - \hat{f}( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr] \le 2t igl[f( oldsymbol{x}) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr] \]

Summing:

\[ \| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_K\|_2^2 - \| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{x}_0\|_2^2 \le 2t \sum_{k=0}^{K-1} igl[f( oldsymbol{x}) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr] \le 2tK igl[f( oldsymbol{x}) - f( oldsymbol{x}_K) igr] \]

i.e.

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_K) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \le rac{\| oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_0\|_2^2}{2tK} \]

And if \(g\) is \(m\)-strong convex, then

\[ egin{aligned} f( oldsymbol{x}) &\ge \hat f( oldsymbol{x}) - \left( rac{1}{2t} - rac{m}{2} ight) \| oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_k\|_2^2 \ \hat f( oldsymbol{x}) &\ge \hat f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) + rac{1}{2t}\| oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}\|_2^2\end{aligned} \]

so

\[ \| oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}\|_2^2 \le (1 - mt)\| oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}\|_2^2 + 2t igl[ f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - \hat f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr] \]

similarly

\[ \| oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}\|_2^2 \le (1 - mt)\| oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}\|_2^2 \]

docs.title: Lasso and ISTA (iterative soft-thresholding algorithm)
docs.text:
Lasso in the penalized form:

\[ \min_{\boldsymbol{w}}F(\boldsymbol{w}) = \frac{1}{2}\Vert \boldsymbol{Xw} - \boldsymbol{y}\Vert^2 + \lambda \Vert \boldsymbol{w}\Vert_1 \]

The proximal gradient step is

\[ \boldsymbol{w}_{k + 1} = S_{\lambda t}(\boldsymbol{w}_k - t\boldsymbol{X}^T(\boldsymbol{XW}_k - \boldsymbol{y})) \]

docs.title: 梯度下降.zh
docs.text:
中文 English

阅读信息

851 字 7 分钟  本页总访问量 加载中...

docs.title: 基本梯度下降（Basic method）
docs.text:
\[ oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1} = oldsymbol{x}_k - t_k abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \]

其中 \(t_k > 0\) 为步长。 方向 \(- abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\) 是在点 \( oldsymbol{x}_k\) 处使函数值下降最快的方向：

为何 \(- abla f\) 是最速下降方向

若 \(\lVert oldsymbol{d}_k Vert_2 = 1\)，

\[ \lim_{t o 0} rac{ f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}_k + t\, oldsymbol{d}_k) }{t} = -\, oldsymbol{d}_k^{T} abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \leq\lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert_2, \]

且当且仅当

\[ oldsymbol{d}_k= - rac{ abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) }{ \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) Vert_2 } \]

时取等号。

Lipschitz 连续（Lipschitz Continuity）

若存在常数 \(C > 0\)，使得对任意 \( oldsymbol{x}, oldsymbol{y}\) 都有

\[ \Vert oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{x}) - oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{y}) \Vert \leq C \Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y} \Vert, \]

则称 \( oldsymbol{f}: \mathbb{R}^n o \mathbb{R}^m\) 是 Lipschitz 连续的。

例子

线性映射 \( oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{x}) = oldsymbol{Qx}\) 是 \(\sigma_ ext{max}( oldsymbol{Q})\)-Lipschitz 的。令 \( oldsymbol{d} = oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y}\)，则

\[ \Vert oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{x}) - oldsymbol{f}( oldsymbol{y}) \Vert^2 = oldsymbol{d}^T oldsymbol{Q}^T oldsymbol{Q} oldsymbol{d} \leq \lambda_ ext{max}( oldsymbol{Q}^T oldsymbol{Q})\Vert oldsymbol{d} \Vert^2. \]

\(L\)-平滑性（\(L\)-smoothness）

若 \(f\) 可导且梯度是 \(L\)-Lipschitz 的，即

\[ \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}) - abla f( oldsymbol{y}) \Vert \leq L \Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y} \Vert, \]

则称 \(f\) 是 \(L\)-smooth 的。

例子

当 \( oldsymbol{Q} \succeq oldsymbol{O}\) 时，函数 \(f( oldsymbol{x}) = oldsymbol{x}^T oldsymbol{Q} oldsymbol{x}\) 是 \(\sigma_ ext{max}( oldsymbol{Q})\)-smooth。

若 \(f:\mathbb{R}^n o \mathbb{R}\) 二阶连续可导且凸，则

\[ f ext{ 是 $L$-smooth} \Longleftrightarrow abla^2f( oldsymbol{x}) \preceq L oldsymbol{I} \Longleftrightarrow \lambda_ ext{max}( abla^2f( oldsymbol{x})) \leq L. \]

docs.title: 二次上界（Quadratic upper bound）
docs.text:
若 \(f\) 是 \(L\)-smooth 的，则对任意 \( oldsymbol{x}, oldsymbol{y}\) 有

\[ f( oldsymbol{y}) \leq f( oldsymbol{x}) + abla f( oldsymbol{x})^T( oldsymbol{y} - oldsymbol{x}) + rac{L}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{y} - oldsymbol{x}\Vert^2. \]

证明思路

先证明一维情形。令 \(g(t)\) 是 \(L_g\)-smooth 的，即 \(\lvert g'(t)-g'(s) vert\le L_g\lvert t-s vert\)。

\[ egin{aligned} g(1) &= g(0)+\int_{0}^{1} g'(t)\mathrm{d}t \ &= g(0)+g'(0)+\int_{0}^{1} igl[g'(t)-g'(0) igr]\mathrm{d}t \ &\leq g(0)+g'(0)+\int_{0}^{1}L_g t\mathrm{d}t \quad ext{因为 }\lvert g'(t)-g'(0) vert\leq L_g t \[4pt] &= g(0)+g'(0)+ rac12 L_g. \end{aligned} \]

对一般情形，取 \(g(t)=f( oldsymbol{x}+t oldsymbol{d})\)，其中 \( oldsymbol{d}= oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x}\)，并令 \(L_g = L \lVert oldsymbol{d} Vert^{2}\)。 检查 \(g\) 的平滑性：

\[ egin{aligned} \lvert g'(t)-g'(s) vert &= igl\lvert [ abla f( oldsymbol{x}+t oldsymbol{d}) - abla f( oldsymbol{x}+s oldsymbol{d})]^T oldsymbol{d} igr vert \[2pt] &\le \lVert abla f( oldsymbol{x}+t oldsymbol{d}) - abla f( oldsymbol{x}+s oldsymbol{d}) Vert \lVert oldsymbol{d} Vert \quad ext{（Cauchy–Schwarz）} \[2pt] &\le (t-s) L \lVert oldsymbol{d} Vert^{2} \quad (f ext{ 为 $L$-smooth}). \end{aligned} \]

二次上界的推论

对 \(L\)-smooth 的 \(f\)，梯度下降产生的序列 \(\{ oldsymbol{x}_k\}\) 满足

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1}) \leq f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - t\left(1 - rac{L}{2}t ight) \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \Vert^2. \]

证明

直接把二次上界应用到 \( oldsymbol{x} = oldsymbol{x}_k\)、\( oldsymbol{y} = oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}\)，并利用 \( abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)^T( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1} - oldsymbol{x}_k) = - t \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \Vert^2\) 即可。

于是

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_{k}) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k + 1}) \geq t\left(1 - rac{L}{2}t ight) \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \Vert^2 \geq rac{1}{2}t \Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) \Vert^2, \]

只要 \(\displaystyle 0 \leq t \leq rac{1}{L}\)（这就是常说的 Descent Lemma）。

收敛性分析（Convergence Analysis）

若步长 \(t \in (0, 1 / L]\)，且 \( oldsymbol{x}^*\) 为 \(f\) 的最小点，则

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq rac{\Vert oldsymbol{x}_0 - oldsymbol{x}^*\Vert^2}{2tk}. \]

一些结论

  • 当 \(k o \infty\) 时，\(f( oldsymbol{x}_k) o f^*\)；
  • 任意收敛子序列的极限点都是最优解；
  • 收敛速率为 \(O(1/k)\)，要达到 \(f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f^* \leq \varepsilon\) 需要的迭代次数是 \(O(1 / \varepsilon)\)；
  • 较大的步长一般能更快收敛，最佳固定步长形式理论上为 \(t = 1 / L\)，但 \(L\) 通常未知。

证明简要

\[ egin{aligned} \| oldsymbol{x}_{k+1} - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 - \| oldsymbol{x}_k - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 &= \| oldsymbol{x}_k - t abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 - \| oldsymbol{x}_k - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 \ &= 2t abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)^T ( oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_k) + t^2 \| abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\|^2 \ & \leq 2t igl[f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{x}_k) igr] + 2t igl[f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr] \ &= 2t igl[f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{x}_{k+1}) igr]. \end{aligned} \]

对 \(k = 0, \ldots, N-1\) 求和可得

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_N) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \le rac{\| oldsymbol{x}_0 - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2}{2tN}. \]

docs.title: 梯度流（Gradient Flow）
docs.text:
梯度下降的连续时间版本为

\[ \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}s}\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s = -\nabla f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s), \]

其中 \(s\) 类似“时间”。

若 \(f\) 为凸函数，\(\boldsymbol{x}^*\) 为其最小点，则在时间 \(T\) 时有

\[ f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_T) - f(\boldsymbol{x}^*) \le \frac{\|\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_0 - \boldsymbol{x}^*\|^2}{2T}. \]

证明思路

\[ \begin{aligned} \frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm ds}\|\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s - \boldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 &= 2\langle \tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s - \boldsymbol{x}^*, \frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm ds}\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s\rangle = 2\langle \nabla f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s), \boldsymbol{x}^* - \tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s\rangle \\[2pt] &\leq 2\bigl(f(\boldsymbol{x}^*) - f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s)\bigr). \end{aligned} \]

在 \([0, T]\) 上积分，并利用 \(f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_s) \ge f(\tilde{\boldsymbol{x}}_T)\) 即可得到所需不等式。

docs.title: 强凸性（Strong Convexity）
docs.text:
若对某个 \(m > 0\)，函数

\[ \tilde{f}(\boldsymbol{x}) = f(\boldsymbol{x}) - \frac{m}{2}\Vert \boldsymbol{x}\Vert^2 \]

是凸的，则称 \(f\) 是 \(m\)-strongly convex。

docs.title: 强凸函数的一阶刻画
docs.text:
可导函数 \(f\) 是 \(m\)-strongly convex 当且仅当对任意 \(\boldsymbol{x}, \boldsymbol{y}\) 有

\[ f(\boldsymbol{y})\geq f(\boldsymbol{x}) + \nabla f(\boldsymbol{x})^T(\boldsymbol{y} - \boldsymbol{x}) + \frac{m}{2}\Vert \boldsymbol{x} - \boldsymbol{y}\Vert^2. \]

证明

从 \(\tilde{f}\) 的凸性展开即可得到上述不等式，反之亦同。

docs.title: 强凸函数的二阶刻画
docs.text:
若 \(f\) 二阶可导，则 \(f\) 是 \(m\)-strongly convex 当且仅当

\[ abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x}) \succeq m oldsymbol{I} \Longleftrightarrow \lambda_{ ext{min}}( abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x})) \geq m. \]

强凸 + 平滑带来的界

若 \(f\) 既是 \(m\)-strongly convex 又是 \(L\)-smooth，则对任意 \( oldsymbol{x}, oldsymbol{y}\) 有

\[ rac{m}{2}\,\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{y}\|^{2}\leq f( oldsymbol{y})-f( oldsymbol{x})- abla f( oldsymbol{x})^{T}( oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x})\leq rac{L}{2}\,\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{y}\|^{2}, \]

更精确地，可以写成

\[ rac{1}{2}\lambda_{ ext{min}}( abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x}))\,\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{y}\|^{2} \leq f( oldsymbol{y})-f( oldsymbol{x})- abla f( oldsymbol{x})^{T}( oldsymbol{y}- oldsymbol{x}) \leq rac{1}{2}\lambda_{ ext{max}}( abla^2 f( oldsymbol{x}))\,\| oldsymbol{x}- oldsymbol{y}\|^{2}. \]

若 \(f\) 是 \(m\)-strongly convex，则对任意 \( oldsymbol{x}\) 与最优点 \( oldsymbol{x}^*\) 有

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq rac{1}{2m}\Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x}) \Vert^2. \]

证明

\[ egin{aligned} f( oldsymbol{x}^*) &= \min_{ oldsymbol{y}}f( oldsymbol{y}) \ &\geq \min_{ oldsymbol{y}} \left[f( oldsymbol{x}) + abla f( oldsymbol{x})^T( oldsymbol{y} - oldsymbol{x}) + rac{m}{2}\Vert oldsymbol{x} - oldsymbol{y}\Vert^2 ight] \ &\geq f( oldsymbol{x}) - rac{1}{2m}\Vert abla f( oldsymbol{x})\Vert^2, \end{aligned} \]

其中下界在选择 \(\displaystyle oldsymbol{y} = oldsymbol{x} - rac{1}{m} abla f( oldsymbol{x})\) 时达到。

docs.title: 强凸情形下梯度流的收敛
docs.text:
若 \(f\) 是 \(m\)-strongly convex，则在梯度流下有

\[ rac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}s}\,\| oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} \le -m\| oldsymbol{ ilde{x}}_{s}- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2}, \]

从而

\[ \Vert ilde{ oldsymbol{x}}_T - oldsymbol{x}^*\Vert^2 \leq \mathrm{e}^{-mT}\Vert ilde{ oldsymbol{x}}_0 - oldsymbol{x}^*\Vert^2. \]

用到的微分不等式

若 \(\displaystyle rac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}x}f(x) \leq C f(x)\)，则

\[ [\mathrm{e}^{Cx} f(x)]' \leq 0 \Longrightarrow \mathrm{e}^{Cx}f(x) \leq f(0) \Longrightarrow f(x) \leq \mathrm{e}^{-Cx}f(0). \]

定理：若 \(f\) \(m\)-strongly convex 且 \(L\)-smooth，\( oldsymbol{x}^*\) 为其最小点，则当步长 \(\displaystyle t \in (0, 1/L]\) 时，梯度下降产生的序列 \(\{ oldsymbol{x}_k\}\) 满足

\[ f( oldsymbol{x}_k)-f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \le (1-mt)^{k} igl[f( oldsymbol{x}_0)-f( oldsymbol{x}^*) igr], \] \[ \| oldsymbol{x}_k- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2} \le (1-mt)^{k}\| oldsymbol{x}_0- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2}. \]

补充说明

  • 为了达到 \(f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - f( oldsymbol{x}^*) \leq \varepsilon\)，所需迭代次数为 \(O(\log (1 / \varepsilon))\)，与精度位数线性相关；
  • 并且有
\[ rac{m}{2}\,\| oldsymbol{x}_k- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2}\leq f( oldsymbol{x}_k)-f( oldsymbol{x}^*)\leq rac{L}{2}\,\| oldsymbol{x}_k- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2}. \]

证明思路

类似前面的推导，

\[ egin{aligned} \| oldsymbol{x}_{k+1} - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 - \| oldsymbol{x}_k - oldsymbol{x}^*\|^2 &= 2t abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)^T ( oldsymbol{x}^* - oldsymbol{x}_k) + t^2 \| abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)\|^2. \end{aligned} \]

由强凸性有

\[ abla f( oldsymbol{x}_k)^{T}( oldsymbol{x}^*- oldsymbol{x}_k) \le f( oldsymbol{x}^*) - f( oldsymbol{x}_k) - rac{m}{2}\| oldsymbol{x}_k- oldsymbol{x}^*\|^{2}, \]

结合 \(L\)-smooth 得到递推不等式，从而推得上述线性收敛结论。

docs.title: 条件数与改进方法（Condition number and Enhanced methods）
docs.text: 对二次函数 \(\displaystyle f(\boldsymbol{x}) = \frac{1}{2}\boldsymbol{x}^T\boldsymbol{Qx}\)，可以用一个数来刻画收敛“好不好”：条件数（condition number）。

docs.title: 条件数（Condition number）
docs.text:
对满足 \(\boldsymbol{Q} \succeq \boldsymbol{O}\) 的矩阵 \(\boldsymbol{Q} \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times n}\)，定义

\[ \kappa(\boldsymbol{Q}) = \frac{\lambda_{\text{max}}(\boldsymbol{Q})}{\lambda_{\text{min}}(\boldsymbol{Q})}. \]

它刻画了 \(\displaystyle f(\boldsymbol{x}) = \frac{1}{2}\boldsymbol{x}^T\boldsymbol{Qx}\) 的等高线被“拉伸”的程度。 在非二次情形下，\(\kappa(\nabla^2 f(\boldsymbol{x}))\) 起到类似的作用。

当 \(\kappa(\boldsymbol{Q})\) 较小时，问题 \(\displaystyle \min_{\boldsymbol{x}}\frac{1}{2}\boldsymbol{x}^T\boldsymbol{Qx}\) 称为 well conditioned；反之则称为 ill conditioned。

docs.title: 精确线搜索（Exact line search）
docs.text:
在每一步中令

\[ t_k = \arg\min_{s > 0} f(\boldsymbol{x}_k - s\nabla f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)), \]

即在梯度方向上做一维最优化。 然而在实际中精确线搜索往往代价较高。

示意

即使每步都做 exact line search，也不一定保证整体收敛速度理想。

收敛性分析（结论）

对 \(m\)-strongly convex 且 \(L\)-smooth 的 \(f\)，精确线搜索下有

\[ f(\boldsymbol{x}_k)-f(\boldsymbol{x}^*) \le \left(1-\frac{m}{L}\right)^{k} \bigl[f(\boldsymbol{x}_0)-f(\boldsymbol{x}^*)\bigr], \]

证明思路与前述线性收敛分析类似，这里省略。

docs.title: 回溯线搜索（Backtracking line search）
docs.text:
回溯线搜索通过逐步缩小步长，在保证下降的前提下自动选择合适的 \(t\)。 取常数 \(\alpha, \beta \in (0, 1)\)，在每一步：

从某个初始步长 \(t\) 开始； 令

\[ t \gets \beta t \]

反复缩小步长，直到满足

\[ f(\boldsymbol{x} - t\nabla f(\boldsymbol{x})) \leq f(\boldsymbol{x}) - \alpha t \Vert \nabla f(\boldsymbol{x})\Vert^2, \]

这就是著名的 Armijo’s rule。

docs.title: 二姐导数的中心差商
docs.text: \[ u''(t)\big|_{t = t_k} = \frac{u(t_{k+1}) - 2u(t_k) + u(t_{k-1})}{(\Delta t)^2} + \mathcal{O}((\Delta t)^2) \]

docs.title: 数值求积公式
docs.text:
\[ \int_a^b f(x) \approx \sum_{k = 0}^n A_k f(x_k) \quad, \left(\sum_{k = 1}^n A_k = 1\right) \]

插值型求积分公式：

\[ f(x) \approx L_n(x) \Longrightarrow \int_a^b f(x) \, dx \approx \int_a^b L_n(x) \, dx \]

Newton–Cotes 公式：等距节点，(高次公式不稳定 v.s. Runge 现象)

\[ L_n(x) = \sum_{k=0}^n f(x_k) l_k(x) \Longrightarrow A_k = \int_a^b l_k(x) \, dx \]

复化梯形公式（Composite Trapezoidal Rule）：

\[ f(x) \approx L_1(x) \Longrightarrow \int_a^b f(x)\,dx \approx \sum_{k=0}^{n-1} \int_{x_k}^{x_{k+1}} L_1(x)\,dx = \frac{h}{2} \left[f(x_0) + 2\sum_{k=1}^{n-1} f(x_k) + f(x_n) \right] \]

其中 $\displaystyle h = \frac{b - a}{n} $，等距节点 $ x_k = a + kh $。

复化Simpson公式（Composite Simpson's Rule）：

\[ f(x) \approx L_2(x) \Longrightarrow \int_a^b f(x)\,dx \approx \sum_{k=0}^{n/2 - 1} \int_{x_{2k}}^{x_{2k+2}} L_2(x)\,dx = \frac{h}{3} \left[f(x_0) + 4\sum_{j=1}^{n/2} f(x_{2j - 1}) + 2\sum_{j=1}^{n/2 - 1} f(x_{2j}) + f(x_n) \right] \]

其中 $\displaystyle h = \frac{b - a}{n} $，要求 $ n $ 为偶数。

docs.title: 常微分方程初值问题
docs.text: \[ \begin{cases} \displaystyle \frac{du}{dt} = f(t, u), & 0 < t \leq T \\ u(0) = u_0 \end{cases} \]

docs.title: 向前 Euler 法
docs.text:
显示方法，计算容易，稳定性不好

\[ \displaystyle u_{k+1} = u_k + \Delta t \cdot f(t_k, u_k), \quad k = 0, 1, \dots, N-1 \]

其中 \(\displaystyle t_k = k \Delta t\)，\(\displaystyle \Delta t = \frac{T}{N}\)。

docs.title: 向后 Euler 法
docs.text:
隐式方法，需求解非线性方程，稳定性好

\[ \displaystyle u_{k+1} = u_k + \Delta t \cdot f(t_{k+1}, u_{k+1}), \quad k = 0, 1, \dots, N-1 \]

其中 \(\displaystyle t_k = k \Delta t\)，\(\displaystyle \Delta t = \frac{T}{N}\)。

如果把一阶微分方程转化为积分形式，有

\[ u(t) = u_0 + \int_{t_0}^t f(s, u(s)) \mathrm{d} s \]

docs.title: 向前 Euler 方法
docs.text: \[ \displaystyle u_{k+1} = u_k + \Delta t \cdot f(t_k, u_k) \]

docs.title: 向后 Euler 方法
docs.text: \[ \displaystyle u_{k+1} = u_k + \Delta t \cdot f(t_{k+1}, u_{k+1}) \]

docs.title: 四阶 Runge-Kutta 方法（RK4）
docs.text:
\[ \begin{cases} \displaystyle k_1 &= f(t_k, u_k) \\ \displaystyle k_2 &= f\left(t_k + \frac{\Delta t}{2}, u_k + \frac{\Delta t}{2} k_1\right) \\ \displaystyle k_3 &= f\left(t_k + \frac{\Delta t}{2}, u_k + \frac{\Delta t}{2} k_2\right) \\ \displaystyle k_4 &= f(t_k + \Delta t, u_k + \Delta t \cdot k_3) \\ \displaystyle u_{k+1} &= u_k + \frac{\Delta t}{6} \left(k_1 + 2k_2 + 2k_3 + k_4\right) \end{cases} \]

其中 \(\displaystyle t_k = k \Delta t,\quad \Delta t = \frac{T}{N}\)。

单步法：Euler方法、Runge-Kutta方法 多步法：Adams方法、NDF方法、BDF方法 非刚性常微分方程：ode45Runge-Kutta方法变步长显格式 刚性常微分方程或者微分代数方程：bde15sNDF/BDF方法变阶数隐格式

docs.title: 二阶偏微分方程
docs.text:
椭圆型方程：稳态热传导方程

\[ \begin{cases} \Delta u(x) = f(x), & x \in \Omega \\ u(x) = g(x), & x \in \partial \Omega \end{cases} \]

抛物型方程：瞬态热传导方程

$$ \begin{cases} \displaystyle \frac{\partial u(x, t)}{\partial t} = \alpha \Delta u(x, t) + f(x, t), & (x, t) \in \Omega \times (0, T) \ \displaystyle u(x, t) = g(x, t), & x \in \partial \Omega, t \in [0, T] \ \displaystyle u(x, 0) = u_0(x), & x \in \Omega \end{cases} $$ \displaystyle 双曲型方程：波动方程

\[ \begin{cases} \displaystyle \frac{\partial^2 u(x, t)}{\partial t^2} = c^2 \frac{\partial^2 u(x, t)}{\partial x^2} + f(x, t), & (x, t) \in \Omega \times (0, T) \\ \displaystyle u(x, t) = g(x, t), & x \in \partial \Omega, \ t \in [0, T] \\ \displaystyle \frac{\partial u(x, t)}{\partial t} \bigg|_{t=0} = h(x), & x \in \Omega \end{cases} \]

一阶双曲型方程：人口发展方程（国赛2007A：中国人口增长预测）

\[ \begin{cases} \displaystyle \frac{\partial u(x, t)}{\partial t} + a \frac{\partial u(x, t)}{\partial x} = f(x, t), & (x, t) \in \Omega \times (0, T) \\ \displaystyle u(x, 0) = u_0(x), & x \in \Omega \end{cases} \]

docs.title: 随机变量的数值性质
docs.text:
• 协方差 \(\mathrm{cov}(X, Y) = E((X - E(X))(Y - E(Y)))\)
  • 相关系数/标准化协方差 \(\rho(X, Y) = \frac{\mathrm{cov}(X, Y)}{\sqrt{D(X)}\sqrt{D(Y)}}\)
  • 变异系数 \(\delta_X = \frac{\sqrt{D(X)}}{\left\lvert E(X)\right\rvert }\)
  • \(k\) 阶原点矩 \(E(X^k)\)
  • \(k\) 阶中心矩 \(E\left((X - E(X))^k\right)\)

docs.title: Chebyshev 不等式
docs.text: \[ P(\left\lvert X - E(X)\right\rvert \geqslant \varepsilon) \leqslant \frac{D(X)}{\varepsilon^2} \]

docs.title: 依概率收敛
docs.text: \(\exists c, \forall \varepsilon > 0, \lim_{n \to +\infty}P\left(\left\lvert X_n - c\right\rvert \leqslant \varepsilon\right) = 1\), 则称随机变量序列 \(\{X_n\}\) 依概率收敛于 \(c\), 记作 \(X_n \xrightarrow[]{P}c\)

docs.title: Chebyshev 大数定律
docs.text:
随机变量序列 \(\{X_n\}\) 两两不(线性)相关，且 \(D(X_i)\) 有一致上界 \(c\) (即 \(D(X_i) < c\)), 则有

\[ \overline{X} = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i = 1}^{n}X_i \xrightarrow{P}\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i = 1}^{n}E(X_i) \]

docs.title: 相互独立同分布(辛钦)大数定律
docs.text:
\(\{X_i\}\) 相互独立同分布， \(E(X_i) = \mu\) 有限，则

\[ \overline{X} = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i = 1}^{n}X_i \xrightarrow{P}\mu \]

docs.title: 列维-林德伯格中心极限定理
docs.text:
\(\{X_i\}\) 相互独立同分布，\(D(X_i) = \sigma^2\) 有限，\(E(X_i) = \mu\)，则

\[ \lim_{n \to \infty}P\left(\frac{\sum_{i = 1}^{n}X_i - n\mu}{\sqrt{n}\sigma}\right) = \Phi(x) \]

即当 \(n\) 充分大时，可以认为 \(\sum_{i = 1}^{n}X_i \overset{\text{近似}}{\sim} N(n\mu, n\sigma^2)\) 或者 \(\overline{X} \overset{\text{近似}}{\sim} N\left(\mu, \frac{\sigma^2}{n}\right)\)

docs.title: 样本方差
docs.text:
\((X_1, X_2, \cdots , X_n)\) 是取自总体的一个样本，称

\[ \overline{X} = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i = 1}^{n}X_i \]

为样本均值，

\[ S^2 = \frac{1}{n - 1}\sum_{i = 1}^{m}\left(X_i - \overline{X}\right)^2 \]

为样本方差.

docs.title: \(\chi^2\) 分布
docs.text:
设 \(\{X_i\}_{i = 1}^n\) 为相互独立的标准正态分布随机变量，称随机变量 \(Y = \sum_{i = 1}^{n}X_i^2\) 服从自由度为 \(n\) 的 \(\chi^2\) 分布，记为 \(Y \sim \chi^2(n)\).

\(\chi^2\) 分布的密度函数为

\[ \begin{aligned} f(y) = \begin{cases} \frac{1}{2^{\frac{n}{2}}\Gamma\left(\frac{n}{2}\right)}y^{\frac{n}{2} - 1}\mathrm{e}^{-\frac{y}{2}}, & \quad y > 0 \\ 0,& \quad \text{其它} \end{cases} \end{aligned} \]

\(Y \sim \chi^2(n)\) 有以下性质 - \(E(Y) = n, D(Y) = 2n\) - 可加性， \(X \sim \chi^2(m), Y \sim \chi^2(n)\), \(X, Y\) 相互独立，则 \(X + Y \sim \chi^2(m + n)\)

docs.title: \(t\) 分布(学生氏分布)
docs.text:
设 \(X, Y\) 相互独立， \(X \sim N(0, 1), Y \sim \chi^2(n)\), 则称 \(T = \frac{X}{\sqrt{Y/n}}\) 服从自由度为 \(n\) 的 \(t\) 分布.

\(t\) 分布的密度函数为

\[ \begin{aligned} f(x) = \frac{\Gamma\left(\frac{n + 1}{2}\right)}{\sqrt{\pi n }\Gamma\left(\frac{n}{2}\right)}\left(1 + \frac{x^2}{n}\right)^{-\frac{n + 1}{2}} \end{aligned} \]

\(t(n)\)的密度函数与标准正态分布 \(N(0, 1)\) 密度很相似, 它们都是关于原点对称, 单峰偶函数, 在 \(x = 0\) 处达到极大. 但 \(t(n)\) 的峰值低于 \(N(0, 1)\) 的峰值, \(t(n)\) 的密度函数尾部都要比 \(N(0, 1)\) 的两侧尾部粗一些. 容易证明:

\[ \lim_{n \to \infty} f(x) = \Phi(x) \]

docs.title: \(F\) 分布
docs.text:
设 \(X, Y\) 相互独立， \(X \sim \chi^2(m), Y \sim \chi^2(n)\), 则称 \(F = \frac{X / m}{Y / n}\) 服从 \(F\) 分布，记为 \(F \sim F(m, n)\) 其中 \(m\) 称为第一自由度， \(n\) 称为第二自由度.

\(F(m, n)\) 分布的概率密度函数为

\[ \begin{aligned} f(y) = \begin{cases} \frac{\Gamma\left(\frac{m + n}{2}\right)}{\Gamma\left(\frac{m}{2}\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{n}{2}\right)}\left(\frac{m}{n}\right)^{\frac{m}{2}}y^{\frac{m}{2} - 1}\left(1 + \frac{m}{n}y\right)^{-\frac{m + n}{2}},& \quad y > 0 \\ 0,& \quad \text{其它} \end{cases} \end{aligned} \]

记 \(F_\alpha(m, n)\) 为 \(F\) 分布的第 \(\alpha\) 分位数 (即 \(P(F \leqslant F_\alpha(m, n)) = \alpha\))

有性质：

\[ F_\alpha(m, n) = \frac{1}{F_{1 - \alpha}}(n, m) \]

docs.title: 正态总体的抽样分布
docs.text: 暂时略.

docs.title: 矩估计
docs.text:
用样本原点矩估计总体原点矩.

设总体的 \(k\) 阶原点矩为 \(\mu_k = E(X^k)\), 样本的 \(k\) 阶原点矩为 \(A_k = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i = 1}^{n}X_i^k\), 用 \(A_k\) 估计 \(\mu_k\), 对某个依赖 \(\mu_1, \mu_2, \cdots, \mu_n\) 的分布参数 \(\theta = \theta(\mu_1, \mu_2, \cdots, \mu_n)\), 有 \(\theta\) 的估计

\[ \hat{\theta} = \theta(A_1, A_2, \cdots, A_n) \]

docs.title: 极大似然估计
docs.text:
定义设总体 \(X\) 有分布律 \(P(X=x;\theta)\) 或密度函数 \(f(x;\theta)\) （其中 \(\theta\) 为一个未知参数或几个未知参数组成的向量 \(\theta=(\theta_1,\theta_2,\cdots,\theta_k)\)），已知 \(\theta\in\Theta\)，\(\Theta\) 是参数空间. \((x_1, x_2, \cdots, x_n)\) 为取自总体 \(X\) 的一个样本 \((X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n)\) 的观测值，将样本的联合分布律或联合密度函数看成 \(\theta\) 的函数，用 \(L(\theta)\) 表示，又称为 \(\theta\) 的似然函数，则似然函数

\[ L(\theta)=\prod_{i=1}^n P\left(X_i=x_i;\theta\right), \text{ 或 } L(\theta)=\prod_{i=1}^n f\left(x_i;\theta\right), \]

称满足关系式 \(L(\hat{\theta})=\max_{\theta\in\Theta} L(\theta)\) 的解 \(\hat{\theta}\) 为 \(\theta\) 的极大似然估计量.

docs.title: 点估计的优良性判断标准
无偏性
docs.text:
设 \(\hat{\theta}=\hat{\theta}(X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n)\) 是 \(\theta\) 的一个估计量，\(\theta\) 取值的参数空间为 \(\Theta\)，若对任意的 \(\theta \in \Theta\)，有

\[ E_\theta\left(\hat{\theta}(X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n)\right) = \theta, \]

则称 \(\hat{\theta}=\hat{\theta}(X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n)\) 是 \(\theta\) 的一个无偏估计（量），否则称为有偏估计（量）. 如果有

\[ \lim_{n \rightarrow \infty} E_\theta\left(\hat{\theta}(X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n)\right) = \theta, \]

则称 \(\hat{\theta}=\hat{\theta}(X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n)\) 是 \(\theta\) 的一个渐近无偏估计（量）. 估计量的无偏性是指，由估计量得到的估计值相对于未知参数真值来说，取某些样本观测值时偏大，取另一些样本观测值时偏小。反复将这个估计量使用多次，就平均来说其偏差为 0。如果估计量不具有无偏性，则无论使用多少次，其平均值也与真值有一定的距离，这个距离就是系统误差了。

docs.title: 有效性
docs.text: 设 \(\hat{\theta}_1\) 和 \(\hat{\theta}_2\) 是 \(\theta\) 的两个无偏估计，若对任意的 \(\theta \in \Theta\)，有 \(D(\hat{\theta}_1) \leqslant D(\hat{\theta}_2)\)，且至少有一个 \(\theta \in \Theta\) 使得上述不等式严格成立，则称 \(\hat{\theta}_1\) 比 \(\hat{\theta}_2\) 有效.

docs.title: 相合性(一致性)
docs.text:
设 \(\hat{\theta} = \hat{\theta}(X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n)\) 是 \(\theta\) 的一个估计量，若对 \(\forall \varepsilon > 0\) ，

\[ \lim_{n \rightarrow \infty} P(|\hat{\theta} - \theta| \geqslant \varepsilon) = 0, \]

则称估计量 \(\hat{\theta}\) 具有相合性（一致性），即 \(\hat{\theta} \xrightarrow{P} \theta\)，或称 \(\hat{\theta}\) 是 \(\theta\) 的相合（一致）估计量.

相合性被视为对估计的一个很基本的要求，如果一个估计量，在样本量不断增大时，它不能把被估参数估计到任意指定的精度内，那么这个估计是不好的. 通常，不满足相合性的估计一般不予考虑.

docs.title: 区间估计
docs.text:
设 \((X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n)\) 是取自总体 \(X\) 的一个样本，总体 \(X \sim f(x; \theta), \theta \in \Theta\) 未知，对于 \(\forall 0 < \alpha < 1\)，若统计量 \(\underline{\theta} = \underline{\theta}(X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n) < \overline{\theta}(X_1, X_2, \cdots, X_n) = \overline{\theta}\)，使得

\[ P(\underline{\theta} \leqslant \theta \leqslant \overline{\theta}) = 1 - \alpha, \theta \in \Theta, \]

则称 \([\underline{\theta}, \overline{\theta}]\) 为 \(\theta\) 的双侧 \(1 - \alpha\) 置信区间，\(\underline{\theta}, \overline{\theta}\) 分别称为 \(\theta\) 的双侧 \(1 - \alpha\) 置信区间的置信下限和置信上限，\(1 - \alpha\) 为置信水平，一旦样本有观测值 \((x_1, x_2, \cdots, x_n)\)，则称相应的 \([\underline{\theta}(x_1, x_2, \cdots, x_n), \overline{\theta}(x_1, x_2, \cdots, x_n)]\) 为置信区间的观测值。

docs.title: 数学建模
docs.text:
证明：当 \(m < n\) 时，

\[ \begin{aligned} \sum_{k = 0}^{n}(-1)^k(n - k)^mC_n^k = 0 \end{aligned} \]

docs.title: Number Multiplication
docs.text:
• Calculate by dividing the two n-digit into two parts and recursion -- \(O(n^2)\)
  • Improvement;
\[ xy = ac \cdot 10^n + (ad + bc) \cdot 10^{n / 2} + bd \]

where \(ad + bc = (a + c) (b + d) - ac - bd\), using 3 times of multiplication instead of 4. We have time complexity (multiply times) of \(\displaystyle O(3^{\log n}) \approx O(n^{1.6})\)

If \(n\) is not 2's power?

Add \(0\).

Karatsuba Algorithm

\[ T(n) = 3T\left(\frac{n}{2}\right) + O(n) \]

To be accurate, \(3T(n / 2)\) should be \(3T(n / 2 + 1)\), as \(a + b, c + d\) may be of \((2n + 1)\)-bit length (due to carry).

\[ \begin{aligned} T(n) &= 3\Bigg( 3T\!\left(\frac{n}{4}\right) + c \cdot \frac{n}{2} \Bigg) + cn = 3^2 T\!\left(\frac{n}{4}\right) + cn\left(1 + \frac{3}{2}\right) \\[6pt] &= 3^3 T\!\left(\frac{n}{2^3}\right) + cn\left(1 + \frac{3}{2} + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^2\right) \\[6pt] &= 3^4 T\!\left(\frac{n}{2^4}\right) + cn\left(1 + \frac{1}{2} + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^2 + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^3\right) \\[6pt] &\ \ \vdots \\[6pt] &= 3^{\log_2 n}T(1) + cn\left(1 + \frac{1}{2} + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^2 + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^3 + \cdots + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^{\log_2 n - 1}\right) \\[6pt] &= O\!\left(n^{\log_2 3}\right) + O\!\left(n^{1+\log_2 1.5}\right) = O\!\left(n^{\log_2 3}\right) \end{aligned} \]

Other better algorithms

  • Toom-Cook: dividing into 3 parts, reduce 9 multiplication into 5 times. → \(O(n^{1.465})\)
  • Schonhage-Strassen (\(O(n \log n \log log n)\))... (based on FFT)

docs.title: Matrix multiplication
docs.text:
Directly calculate, \(O(n^3)\)

Strassen’s magical idea:

\[ \begin{cases} P_{1} = A(F - H) \\ P_{2} = (A + B)H \\ P_{3} = (C + D)E \\ P_{4} = D(G - E) \\ P_{5} = (A + D)(E + H) \\ P_{6} = (B - D)(G + H) \\ P_{7} = (A - C)(E + F) \end{cases} \]

then

\[ \begin{aligned} XY &= \begin{pmatrix} A & B \\ C & D \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} E & F \\ G & H \end{pmatrix} \\[6pt] &= \begin{pmatrix} AE + BG & AF + BH \\ CE + DG & BF + DH \end{pmatrix} \\[6pt] &= \begin{pmatrix} P_{5} + P_{4} - P_{2} + P_{6} & P_{1} + P_{2} \\ P_{3} + P_{4} & P_{1} + P_{5} - P_{3} - P_{7} \end{pmatrix} \end{aligned} \]

reducing 8 multiplication into 7.

Others: - Strassen: \(n^\omega, \omega \leq \log_2^7\) - Conjecture (猜想) \(\omega = 2 + \varepsilon\) for any \(\varepsilon > 0\).

docs.title: Sorting
docs.text:
(Omitted)

Merge Sort analysis:

\[ T(n) = 2T\left(\frac{n}{2}\right) + O(n) \]

So

\[ T(n) \leq 2T(n / 2) + cn \leq 2 B \cdot \frac{n}{2} \log \frac{n}{2} + cn \leq Bn\log n \]

The lower bound of compare sorting is \(\Omega(n \log n)\)

Total number of possible outputs is \(3^{K(n)}\) if \(K(n)\) comparisons are made. The total number of possible orders is \(n!\), and the algorighm needs to distinguish them. So

\[ 3^{K(n)} \geq n! \Rightarrow K(n) \geq \log \]

docs.title: Master Theorem
docs.text:
If \(T(n) = aT(n / b) + O(n^d)\), then

\[ T(n) = \begin{cases} \displaystyle O(n^d), &\quad a < b^d \\ \displaystyle O(n^{\log_ba}), &\quad a > b^d \\ \displaystyle O(n^d\log n), &\quad a = b^d \end{cases} \]

docs.title: Selection Problem
docs.text:
Find the \(k\)-th smallest integer among \(x_1, \cdots, x_n\),

A solution the same as quick sort: select the arbitrary item \(x_0\) and divide the array into \(L: x < x_0, M: x = x_0, R: x > x_0\), and recurse.

However, the worse case is \(O(n^2)\).

Median of the medians (1973)

step1. partition S into subsets with size 5 (\(O(n)\)) step2. find the medians of the median of each subset (\(O(n)\)) step3. fix \(x_0\) to be the median of all the medians (by recursion: the \(n / 2\) least) (\(T(n / 5)\))

Analysis: there is about \(3n / 10\) numbers larger than \(x_0\) in the worst case, i.e. \(\text{the-} 3 / 10 \text{-th} \leq x_0 \leq \text{the-} 7 / 10 \text{-th}\) (Why?)

So \(T(n) = T(n / 5) + T(7n / 10) + O(n)\)

\(T(n) --> 0.9T(n)\) after each iteration, so we guess \(T(n) \leq Bn\).

\[ T(n) \leq \frac{1}{5}Bn + \frac{7}{10}Bn + Cn \leq 0.9Bn + Cn \leq Bn \]

holds if \(B \geq 10C\).

So \(T(n) = O(n)\)

So why we divide into size 5?

Assume we divide into size \(t\), then \(\displaystyle x_0 \in \left[\frac{3t - 1}{4t}, \frac{t + 1}{4t}\right]\) (when \(t\) is odd). So

\[ T(n) = T(n / t) + T\left(\frac{(3t - 1)n}{4t}\right) + O(n) \]

\(T(n) = O(n)\) iff. \(\displaystyle \frac{1}{t} + \frac{(3t - 1)}{4t} \leq 1\) iff. \(t \geq 5\).

  • If \(t = 3\), \(T(n) = O(n \log n)\)

docs.title: Quick Sort
docs.text:
By Median of the medians, we have \(O(n)\) to find the median number. So

\[ T(n) = 2T(n / 2) + O(n) \Rightarrow T(n) = O(n \log n) \]

However, it is low in practice! (Median of the medians is low due to the large constant \(B\)!)

Choose the pivot item by random:

let \(a_i\): the \(i\)-th smallest number in the array, \(\displaystyle X_{ij} =\begin{cases}1, & a_i, a_j \text{ have been compared} \\ 0, &\text{otherwise}\end{cases}\), and \(X: \text{Total compare times}\).

So we have \(\mathbb{E}(X) = \mathbb{E}\sum X_{ij} = \sum P(X_{ij} = 1)\).

\(X_{ij} = 0\) iff. \(a_i, a_j\) have been divided into 2 different groups. Noting that all the number will be chosen once during the whole algorithm, and we only pay attention to the first number chosen between \(a_i, a_j\). So \(\displaystyle P(X_{ij} = 1) = \frac{2}{j - i + 1}\) (they are not divided at first).

So \(\displaystyle \mathbb{E}(X) = \sum \frac{2}{j - i + 1} = \Theta (n \log n)\)

The derivation

Let \(d = j - i\)

\[ \begin{align} \mathbb{E}(X) =& \sum_{d = 1}^{n - 1}\frac{2(n - d)}{d + 1} \\ =& (2n + 2)\sum_{d = 1}^{n - 1}\frac{1}{d + 1} - 2(n - 1) \\ \approx& (2n + 2)\log n - 2(n - 1) = \Theta (n \log n) \end{align} \]

docs.title: Closest Pairs
docs.text: Find the closest dot pair on the 2-D plane.

docs.title: Polynomial Multiplication -- FFT
docs.text:
Let \(p(x) = a_0 + \ldots + a_{d - 1}x^{d - 1}, q(x) = b_0 + \ldots + b_{d - 1}x^{d - 1}\).

Solution 1: Adapting Karatsuba Algorithm → \(O(d^{\log_2 3})\)

A \(O(d \log d)\) solution: FFT

step1. Choose \(2d - 1\) distinct numbers \(a_0, \cdots, a_{2d - 2}\), and compute \(p(a_i), q(a_i)\)

We can view polynomial evaluation as a matrix–vector multiplication:

\[ \begin{pmatrix}p(x_0) \\ \vdots \\ p(x_{d - 1})\end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix}1 & \cdots & x^{d - 1} \\ \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ x^{d - 1} & \cdots & x^{(d - 1)(d - 1)}\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}a_0 \\ \vdots \\ a_{d - 1}\end{pmatrix} \]

Directly compute every \(p(a_i), q(a_i)\): \(O(d^2)\) → bad! However, computing each \(p(a_i)\) requires \(O(d)\) time!

Noting that if we let

\[ \begin{align} p_e(x) &= a_0 + a_2 x + \cdots + a_{d - 2}x^{d/2 - 1} \\ p_o(x) &= a_1 + a_3x + \cdots + a_{d - 1}x^{d / 2 - 1} \end{align} \]

then

\[ p(x) = p_e(x^2) + xp_o(x^2) \]

Let \(a_1 = - a_0, a_3 = -a_2, \cdots\)

\[ \begin{align} p(a_1) &= p_e(a_0^2) - a_0p_o(a_0^2) \\ p(a_0) &= p_e(a_0^2) + a_0p_o(a_0^2) \end{align} \]

By this we can just compute half of \(p(a_i)\). So with the same task size, we reduce degree \(d\) to \(d / 2\).

Then recursively compute \(p_e\) and \(p_o\), total time complexity \(O(d \log d)\).

To ensure the recurse is continuous, in practice we use the unit roots: \(\displaystyle \omega = \mathrm{e}^{\frac{2\pi}{d}i}\)

Text Only
FFT(p, w):
    If w = 1: return p(1)
    Define p_e(x) and p_o(x)

    (p_e(w^0), p_e(w^2), ..., p_e(w^{D - 2})) = FFT(p_e, w^2)
    (p_o(w^0), p_o(w^2), ..., p_o(w^{D - 2})) = FFT(p_o, w^2)

    For t = 0, 1, ..., D - 1:
        p(w^t) = p_e(w^{2t}) + w^t p_o(w^{2t})
    Return (p(w^0), ..., p(w^{D - 1}))

step2. Compute \(r(a_i) = p(a_i)q(a_i)\), \(O(d)\).

step3. Compute \(r(x)\).

\[ \begin{pmatrix} r(1)\\ r(\omega)\\ r(\omega^{2})\\ \vdots\\ r(\omega^{d-1}) \end{pmatrix} = \underbrace{\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 & \cdots & 1\\ 1 & \omega & \omega^{2} & \cdots & \omega^{d-1}\\ 1 & \omega^{2} & \omega^{4} & \cdots & \omega^{2(d-1)}\\ \vdots & \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots\\ 1 & \omega^{d-1} & \omega^{2(d-1)} & \cdots & \omega^{(d-1)(d-1)} \end{pmatrix}}_{A} \begin{pmatrix} c_0\\ c_1\\ c_2\\ \vdots\\ c_{d-1} \end{pmatrix} \]

And due to \(\displaystyle \frac{1}{\sqrt{d}}A\) is orthonormal, \(\displaystyle \left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{d}}A\right)^{-1} = \left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{d}}A\right)^* = \overline{\left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{d}}A\right)^T}\). So \(\displaystyle A(\omega)^{-1} = \frac{1}{d}A(\omega)^*\). Noting:

\[ \left(A(\omega)^{-1}\right)_{i, j} = \frac{1}{d} \overline{\left(A(\omega)\right)_{j, i}} = \frac{1}{d}\left(\omega^{-1}\right)^{(i - 1)(j - 1)} \]

So \(\displaystyle A(\omega)^{-1} = \frac{1}{D}\cdot A\left(\omega^{-1}\right)\)

\[ \begin{pmatrix} c_0\\ c_1\\ c_2\\ \vdots\\ c_{d-1} \end{pmatrix} = \frac{1}{D} \cdot A(\omega^{-1}) \cdot \begin{pmatrix} r(1)\\ r(\omega)\\ r(\omega^{2})\\ \vdots\\ r(\omega^{d-1}) \end{pmatrix} \]

It is same as compute \(\displaystyle s\left(x\right) = \frac{r(1)}{d} + \frac{r(\omega)}{d}x + \ldots + \frac{r(\omega^{d - 1})}{d}x^{d - 1}\) with \(x = \omega^{-1}, \ldots, \omega^{-(d - 1)}\). So we can apply function FFT in \(O(d \log d)\)!

docs.title: 数字乘法（Number Multiplication）
docs.text:
• 直接把两个 \(n\) 位数各拆分成两部分，递归计算乘积，时间复杂度为 \(O(n^2)\)；
  • 可以做改进：
\[ xy = ac \cdot 10^n + (ad + bc) \cdot 10^{n / 2} + bd \]

其中

\[ ad + bc = (a + c)(b + d) - ac - bd \]

这样可以用 3 次乘法替代原来的 4 次乘法。 于是其乘法次数的时间复杂度为 \(\displaystyle O(3^{\log n}) \approx O(n^{1.6})\)。

如果 \(n\) 不是 2 的幂怎么办？

在高位补 \(0\) 即可。

Karatsuba 算法

\[ T(n) = 3T\left(\frac{n}{2}\right) + O(n) \]

更精确地说，由于 \(a + b, c + d\) 可能是 \((2n + 1)\) 位长（存在进位），\(3T(n / 2)\) 应该写成 \(3T(n / 2 + 1)\)。

展开递推：

\[ \begin{aligned} T(n) &= 3\Bigg( 3T\!\left(\frac{n}{4}\right) + c \cdot \frac{n}{2} \Bigg) + cn = 3^2 T\!\left(\frac{n}{4}\right) + cn\left(1 + \frac{3}{2}\right) \\[6pt] &= 3^3 T\!\left(\frac{n}{2^3}\right) + cn\left(1 + \frac{3}{2} + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^2\right) \\[6pt] &= 3^4 T\!\left(\frac{n}{2^4}\right) + cn\left(1 + \frac{1}{2} + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^2 + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^3\right) \\[6pt] &\ \ \vdots \\[6pt] &= 3^{\log_2 n}T(1) + cn\left(1 + \frac{1}{2} + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^2 + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^3 + \cdots + \left(\frac{3}{2}\right)^{\log_2 n - 1}\right) \\[6pt] &= O\!\left(n^{\log_2 3}\right) + O\!\left(n^{1+\log_2 1.5}\right) = O\!\left(n^{\log_2 3}\right) \end{aligned} \]

更快的乘法算法

  • Toom-Cook：把数拆成 3 段，把 9 次乘法降到 5 次，对应时间复杂度 \(O(n^{1.465})\)；
  • Schonhage-Strassen：时间复杂度 \(O(n \log n \log \log n)\)，基于 FFT。

docs.title: 矩阵乘法（Matrix Multiplication）
docs.text:
直接按定义计算矩阵乘法，时间复杂度为 \(O(n^3)\)。

Strassen 的巧妙思路如下。设

\[ \begin{cases} P_{1} = A(F - H) \\ P_{2} = (A + B)H \\ P_{3} = (C + D)E \\ P_{4} = D(G - E) \\ P_{5} = (A + D)(E + H) \\ P_{6} = (B - D)(G + H) \\ P_{7} = (A - C)(E + F) \end{cases} \]

则有

\[ \begin{aligned} XY &= \begin{pmatrix} A & B \\ C & D \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} E & F \\ G & H \end{pmatrix} \\[6pt] &= \begin{pmatrix} AE + BG & AF + BH \\ CE + DG & BF + DH \end{pmatrix} \\[6pt] &= \begin{pmatrix} P_{5} + P_{4} - P_{2} + P_{6} & P_{1} + P_{2} \\ P_{3} + P_{4} & P_{1} + P_{5} - P_{3} - P_{7} \end{pmatrix} \end{aligned} \]

从而把 8 次矩阵乘法降到了 7 次。

此外还有更快的矩阵乘法算法，例如：

  • Strassen：复杂度 \(n^\omega, \omega \leq \log_2^7\)；
  • Conjecture：对任意 \(\varepsilon > 0\)，都有 \(\omega = 2 + \varepsilon\)。

docs.title: 排序（Sorting）
docs.text:
（略）

以归并排序为例分析递推式：

\[ T(n) = 2T\left(\frac{n}{2}\right) + O(n) \]

于是

\[ T(n) \leq 2T(n / 2) + cn \leq 2 B \cdot \frac{n}{2} \log \frac{n}{2} + cn \leq Bn\log n \]

基于比较模型的排序下界为 \(\Omega(n \log n)\)

若算法进行了 \(K(n)\) 次比较，则可能的比较结果序列共有 \(3^{K(n)}\) 种。 而待排序的 \(n\) 个元素的排列方式共有 \(n!\) 种，算法必须能把这些排列全部区分开来，因此

\[ 3^{K(n)} \geq n! \Rightarrow K(n) \geq \log n! \]

docs.title: 主定理（Master Theorem）
docs.text:
若递推式形如 \(T(n) = aT(n / b) + O(n^d)\)，则

\[ T(n) = \begin{cases} \displaystyle O(n^d), &\quad a < b^d \\ \displaystyle O(n^{\log_ba}), &\quad a > b^d \\ \displaystyle O(n^d\log n), &\quad a = b^d \end{cases} \]

docs.title: 选择问题（Selection Problem）
docs.text:
在 \(x_1, \cdots, x_n\) 中寻找第 \(k\) 小的数。

一种思路与快速排序类似：任选一个枢轴 \(x_0\)，把数组分成三部分： \(L: x < x_0,\ M: x = x_0,\ R: x > x_0\)，然后递归地在对应区间继续查找。

但这种方法在最坏情况下时间复杂度为 \(O(n^2)\)。

Median of the medians 算法（1973）

step1. 将集合 \(S\) 按大小为 5 的子集划分（\(O(n)\)）； step2. 在每个子集中找到中位数，再把这些中位数放在一起，再求它们的中位数（\(O(n)\)）； step3. 把这个“中位数的中位数”作为 \(x_0\)（通过递归在所有中位数中找第 \(n / 2\) 小的元素，复杂度为 \(T(n / 5)\)）。

分析：在最坏情况下，大约有 \(3n / 10\) 个数大于 \(x_0\)，即

\[ \text{the-} 3 / 10 \text{-th} \leq x_0 \leq \text{the-} 7 / 10 \text{-th} \]

（为什么？）

因此有

\[ T(n) = T(n / 5) + T(7n / 10) + O(n) \]

每次迭代之后 \(T(n)\) 大致变成 \(0.9T(n)\)，因此猜测 \(T(n) \leq Bn\)。

验证这一猜测：

\[ T(n) \leq \frac{1}{5}Bn + \frac{7}{10}Bn + Cn \leq 0.9Bn + Cn \leq Bn \]

只要 \(B \geq 10C\) 即可成立，因此 \(T(n) = O(n)\)。

为什么要分成 5 个一组？

假设我们把集合按大小为 \(t\) 的子集划分，则当 \(t\) 为奇数时，有

\[ x_0 \in \left[\frac{3t - 1}{4t}, \frac{t + 1}{4t}\right] \]

因而递推式变为

\[ T(n) = T(n / t) + T\left(\frac{(3t - 1)n}{4t}\right) + O(n) \]

当且仅当

\[ \frac{1}{t} + \frac{3t - 1}{4t} \leq 1 \]

即 \(t \geq 5\) 时，才能得到 \(T(n) = O(n)\)。

  • 若 \(t = 3\)，则有 \(T(n) = O(n \log n)\)。*

docs.title: 快速排序（Quick Sort）
docs.text:
借助 Median of the medians 算法，我们可以用 \(O(n)\) 的时间找到中位数，于是

\[ T(n) = 2T(n / 2) + O(n) \Rightarrow T(n) = O(n \log n) \]

不过在实际中，这个算法常数很大，速度并不理想（主要是 Median of the medians 本身比较“重”）。

随机选择枢轴（randomized quick sort）：

记 \(a_i\) 为数组中第 \(i\) 小的元素，令

\[ X_{ij} = \begin{cases} 1, & a_i, a_j \text{ 在排序过程中被比较过} \\ 0, & \text{否则} \end{cases} \]

并记 \(X\) 为总的比较次数，则

\[ \mathbb{E}(X) = \mathbb{E}\left[\sum X_{ij}\right] = \sum \Pr(X_{ij} = 1) \]

当且仅当 \(a_i, a_j\) 被首次选作枢轴的那个数把它们分到了不同分组时，有 \(X_{ij} = 0\)。 注意到在算法执行过程中，每个数只会被选作枢轴一次，我们只需关注在 \(a_i, a_j\) 之间最先被选出来的那个数。 因此

\[ \Pr(X_{ij} = 1) = \frac{2}{j - i + 1} \]

（第一次选出的枢轴刚好是 \(a_i\) 或 \(a_j\) 的概率）。

于是

\[ \mathbb{E}(X) = \sum \frac{2}{j - i + 1} = \Theta (n \log n) \]

推导过程

令 \(d = j - i\)，则

\[ \begin{align} \mathbb{E}(X) =& \sum_{d = 1}^{n - 1}\frac{2(n - d)}{d + 1} \\ =& (2n + 2)\sum_{d = 1}^{n - 1}\frac{1}{d + 1} - 2(n - 1) \\ \approx& (2n + 2)\log n - 2(n - 1) = \Theta (n \log n) \end{align} \]

docs.title: 最近点对（Closest Pairs）
docs.text: 在平面上找到欧几里得距离最近的一对点。

docs.title: 多项式乘法与 FFT（Polynomial Multiplication -- FFT）
docs.text:
设

\[ p(x) = a_0 + \ldots + a_{d - 1}x^{d - 1},\quad q(x) = b_0 + \ldots + b_{d - 1}x^{d - 1}. \]

做法 1：直接套用 Karatsuba 算法，复杂度为 \(O(d^{\log_2 3})\)。

一个更快的方案是利用 FFT，把复杂度降到 \(O(d \log d)\)。

step1：选择 \(2d - 1\) 个互不相同的点 \(a_0, \cdots, a_{2d - 2}\)，并计算所有 \(p(a_i), q(a_i)\)。

可以把多项式求值视作一次矩阵–向量乘法：

\[ \begin{pmatrix}p(x_0) \\ \vdots \\ p(x_{d - 1})\end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix}1 & \cdots & x^{d - 1} \\ \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ x^{d - 1} & \cdots & x^{(d - 1)(d - 1)}\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}a_0 \\ \vdots \\ a_{d - 1}\end{pmatrix} \]

直接逐点计算所有 \(p(a_i), q(a_i)\) 的复杂度是 \(O(d^2)\)（不理想）。 不过计算单个 \(p(a_i)\) 的开销是 \(O(d)\)。

设

\[ \begin{align} p_e(x) &= a_0 + a_2 x + \cdots + a_{d - 2}x^{d/2 - 1} \\ p_o(x) &= a_1 + a_3x + \cdots + a_{d - 1}x^{d / 2 - 1} \end{align} \]

则

\[ p(x) = p_e(x^2) + xp_o(x^2) \]

再令 \(a_1 = - a_0, a_3 = -a_2, \cdots\)，有

\[ \begin{align} p(a_1) &= p_e(a_0^2) - a_0p_o(a_0^2) \\ p(a_0) &= p_e(a_0^2) + a_0p_o(a_0^2) \end{align} \]

这样就只需要计算一半的 \(p(a_i)\)。在任务规模不变的情况下，我们把多项式的次数从 \(d\) 降到了 \(d / 2\)。

递归地对 \(p_e\) 与 \(p_o\) 做同样的处理，总时间复杂度为 \(O(d \log d)\)。

为保证递归结构可以一直延伸下去，实际中我们会选取单位根：\(\displaystyle \omega = \mathrm{e}^{\frac{2\pi}{d}i}\)。

Text Only
FFT(p, w):
    If w = 1: return p(1)
    Define p_e(x) and p_o(x)

    (p_e(w^0), p_e(w^2), ..., p_e(w^{D - 2})) = FFT(p_e, w^2)
    (p_o(w^0), p_o(w^2), ..., p_o(w^{D - 2})) = FFT(p_o, w^2)

    For t = 0, 1, ..., D - 1:
        p(w^t) = p_e(w^{2t}) + w^t p_o(w^{2t})
    Return (p(w^0), ..., p(w^{D - 1}))

step2：计算 \(r(a_i) = p(a_i)q(a_i)\)，复杂度为 \(O(d)\)。

step3：由所有 \(r(a_i)\) 恢复多项式 \(r(x)\)。

\[ \begin{pmatrix} r(1)\\ r(\omega)\\ r(\omega^{2})\\ \vdots\\ r(\omega^{d-1}) \end{pmatrix} = \underbrace{\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 & \cdots & 1\\ 1 & \omega & \omega^{2} & \cdots & \omega^{d-1}\\ 1 & \omega^{2} & \omega^{4} & \cdots & \omega^{2(d-1)}\\ \vdots & \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots\\ 1 & \omega^{d-1} & \omega^{2(d-1)} & \cdots & \omega^{(d-1)(d-1)} \end{pmatrix}}_{A} \begin{pmatrix} c_0\\ c_1\\ c_2\\ \vdots\\ c_{d-1} \end{pmatrix} \]

由于 \(\displaystyle \frac{1}{\sqrt{d}}A\) 是酉矩阵，有

\[ \left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{d}}A\right)^{-1} = \left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{d}}A\right)^* = \overline{\left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{d}}A\right)^T} \]

因此

\[ A(\omega)^{-1} = \frac{1}{d}A(\omega)^* \]

并且

\[ \left(A(\omega)^{-1}\right)_{i, j} = \frac{1}{d} \overline{\left(A(\omega)\right)_{j, i}} = \frac{1}{d}\left(\omega^{-1}\right)^{(i - 1)(j - 1)} \]

从而

\[ A(\omega)^{-1} = \frac{1}{D}\cdot A\left(\omega^{-1}\right) \]

于是

\[ \begin{pmatrix} c_0\\ c_1\\ c_2\\ \vdots\\ c_{d-1} \end{pmatrix} = \frac{1}{D} \cdot A(\omega^{-1}) \cdot \begin{pmatrix} r(1)\\ r(\omega)\\ r(\omega^{2})\\ \vdots\\ r(\omega^{d-1}) \end{pmatrix} \]

这相当于构造多项式

\[ s(x) = \frac{r(1)}{d} + \frac{r(\omega)}{d}x + \ldots + \frac{r(\omega^{d - 1})}{d}x^{d - 1} \]

然后在 \(x = \omega^{-1}, \ldots, \omega^{-(d - 1)}\) 这些点上求值。 因此可以再次调用 FFT，同样在 \(O(d \log d)\) 的时间内完成。

docs.title: Dynamic Programming
docs.text:
Dependency of sub-problems forms a DAG, and solve the problem through the topological order.

Two implementations: 1. Topological Ordering: find a topological ordering and solve it step by step. 2. Memoization: backward recursion with storing

docs.title: Longest Increasing Subsequence (LIS)
docs.text:
Enumerate the last number \(a_i\), we have \(\displaystyle LIS(a_{i}) = \max_{j < i, a_j < a_i} LIS(a_j) + 1\)

Text Only
lis[0] = 0

for i = 1..n:
    lis[i] = max_{j < i, a_j < a_i} lis[j] + 1

return max lis[i]

There exists a \(O(\log n)\) algorithm!

(To be completed)

docs.title: Edit Distance
docs.text:
Decide the distance from one string for another. Distance is measured by the number of steps of Insertion, Deletion and Replacement

Algorithm: Let \(X[1..m], Y[1..n]\) be the input strings. let \(ED[i, j]\) be the edit distance between strings \(X[1..i]\) and \(Y[1..j]\), then consider the last character, we have:

Operation Meaning Subproblem Replace \(x_i \rightarrow y_j\) Fix last char directly \(ED[i-1,j-1] + 1_{x_i \neq y_j}\) Insert \(y_j\) Match \(y_j\) by adding it to \(X\) \(ED[i,j-1] + 1\) Delete \(x_i\) Remove unmatched \(x_i\) \(ED[i-1,j] + 1\) \[ ED[i, j] = \min\{ED[i - 1, j - 1] + 1_{x_i \neq y_j}, ED[i, j - 1] + 1, ED[i - 1, j] + 1\} \]

docs.title: Knapsack Problems
docs.text:
Input: \(n\) items with cost \(c_i\) and value \(v_i\), and a capacity \(W\). Output: Select a subset of items, with total cost at most \(W\). The goal is to maximize the total value.

It is an NP-hard problem.

Why?

Assume \(c_i = v_i\) for all \(i\) and \(W\) is half of the total cost \(\sum c_i\), then it is reduced into a partition problem!

Define \(f[i, w]\): the maximum value we can get by using the first \(i\) items, and with \(w\) budget (the sum of the costs)

Decision on item \(i\) Meaning Subproblem used Skip item \(i\) Do not use this item \(f[i-1, w]\) Take item \(i\) Use this item and pay its cost \(c_i\) (only if \(c_i \le w\)) \(f[i-1, w - c_i]\) \[ f[i, w] = \begin{cases} \max\{f[i-1, w],\; f[i-1, w - c_i] + v_i\} & c_i \leq w, \\ f[i-1, w] & c_i > w . \end{cases} \]

Analysis

The time complexity: \(O(nW)\), which is not polynomial!

Any approximate solutions in poly time?

If we reduce \(w\) to \(w / K\) which \(w / k\) is polynomial in \(n\) (reducing precision), we can turn the problem into poly time. However, the lost precision in \(w\) will cause invalid solutions!

So we have to change the formal algorithm.

Let \(V = \max v_i\), Obviously \(\mathrm{OPT} \leq nV\). Define new sub-problems:

\(A[i, v]\): the minimum cost \(\mathrm{cost}(S)\) we can have if we select \(S \subseteq\{1, \ldots, n\}\) with value \(\mathrm{value}(S) = v\). This DP turns knapsack into minimizing cost while fixing value

Decision on item \(i\) Meaning Subproblem used Skip item \(i\) Do not use this item \(A[i-1, v]\) Take item \(i\) Use this item and gain value \(v_i\) (only if \(v_i \le v\)) \(A[i-1, v - v_i]\) \[ A[i, v] = \begin{cases} \min\{A[i-1, v],\; A[i-1, v - v_i] + c_i\}, & v_i \le v, \\ A[i-1, v], & v_i > v . \end{cases} \]

And return \(\max\{v\ |\ A[n, v] \leq W\}\)

analysis

Now time complexity \(O(n^2 V)\).

Now choose a large \(K\) (decide later), and let \(v_i' = \lfloor v_i / K \rfloor\), we can have a poly time approximation.

Approximation ratio?

Let \(O\) be the optimal bundle in the original set. We gonna decide the lower bound of \(\mathrm{value}(S) / \mathrm{value}(O)\).

Due to

\[ v_i \leq Kv_i' + K \]

then

\[ \mathrm{value}(O) - K \mathrm{value}'(O) \leq nK \]

so

\[ \begin{aligned} \mathrm{value}(S) &\geq K \cdot \mathrm{value}'(S) \\ & \geq K \cdot \mathrm{value}'(O) \geq \mathrm{value}(O) - nK \\ &= \left(1 - \frac{nK}{\mathrm{value}(O)}\right)\mathrm{value}(O) \geq \left(1 - \frac{nK}{V}\right)\mathrm{value}(O) \end{aligned} \]

docs.title: PTAS and FPTAS -- type of approximation algorithm
docs.text:
Knapsack Problems is an example of FPTAS problem (Fully Polynomial Time Approximation Scheme)

A PTAS is an approximation algorithm that, for any \(\varepsilon > 0\), returns a solution within a factor of \((1 + \varepsilon)\) for minimization (or \((1 - \varepsilon)\) for maximization). For every fixed \(\varepsilon\), the running time is polynomial in the input size \(n\), but may be exponential in \(1/\varepsilon\)

An FPTAS is a PTAS whose running time is polynomial in both the input size \(n\), and \(1/\varepsilon\).

docs.title: Floyd-Warshall Algorithm
docs.text:
All pairs shortest paths: Input a directed weighted graph \(G = (V, E, w)\) Output \(dist(u, v)\) for all pairs of vertices.

Actually, running Bellman-Ford algorithm for all vertices will cost about \(O(\vert V \vert^2 \vert E \vert)\) time (also check if negative cycle exists). By Floyd-Warshall, it will be \(O(\vert V \vert^3)\)

Subproblem: label all vertices by \(1, 2, \ldots, n\), \(\operatorname{dist}_k(i, j)\) the distance between \(i\) and \(j\) by only using intermediate vertices form \(\{1, 2, \ldots, k\}\).

Obviously

\[ \operatorname{dist}_{k + 1}(i, j) = \min \{\operatorname{dist}_k(i, j), \operatorname{dist}_k(i, k + 1), \operatorname{dist}_k(k + 1, j)\} \]

So it is a \(O(\vert V \vert^3)\) algorithm (Let \(d(i, j, k) = \operatorname{dist}_k(i, j)\)). A natural topological order: increasing order in \(k\); order of vertices in \(d(\cdot, \cdot, k)\) can be arbitrary.

Initialization:

\[ d(i, j, 0) = \begin{cases} \infty, & \quad i \neq j, (i, j) \notin E \\ w(i, j) & \quad (i, j) \in E \\ 0, &\quad i = j \end{cases} \]

A Trick

There is a trick to reduce the space complexity from \(O(\vert V \vert^3)\) to \(O(\vert V \vert^2)\): due to the update order (we never use layers before \(k\) at \(k + 1\) iteration), the new \(k + 1\) layer could overlap the \(k\) layer. Now

\[ d(i, j) = \min \{d(i, j), d(i, k + 1) + d(k + 1, j)\} \]

Actually a lot of DPs can apply this trick!

Notice: If we view \(d(i, j)\) as subproblems, the dependency does NOT form a DAG.

docs.title: DP with Exhaustive Searches: Non-attacking Kings
docs.text:
Given an \(m \times n\) chessboard, how many different ways we can place "Kings" such that no pair of them are in the attack range (\(3 \times 3\) centered) of each other. We will design a DP based algorithm with \(O(4^n m)\) time.

Let \(H(i)\): number of placements on the \(i \times n\) sub-chessboard

Simply build relationship from \(H(0), \ldots, H(i - 1)\) is hard because such \(H(i)\) does not contain enough information! (whether its border has Kings and where, i.e. the information of row \(i\)).

Encoding Availability of a Row

Use a length-\(n\) binary string \(w\) to encode availability: - \(w[i] = 0\) if the \(i\)-th cell of this row can put a King (available) - \(w[i] \neq 0\) if the \(i\)-th cell of this row cannot put a King (unavailable)

Then we define \(H[i, w]\): number of placements such that the availability of the cells at the \(i\)-th row follows \(w\)

Then the feasible state transition:

\[ H[i + 1, w_0] = \sum_{\substack{w \text{ feasible} \\\text{for }w_0 \\ \text{in row }i}}H[i, w] \]

and \(w\) feasible iff.

\[ \begin{aligned} &\texttt{(s \& t) == 0} \\ \texttt{\&\& } &\texttt{(s \& (t << 1)) == 0} \\ \texttt{\&\& } &\texttt{((s << 1) \& t) == 0} \end{aligned} \]

Analysis

\(m\) rows; each row: \(2^n\) atates; each row, each state: at most \(2^n\) placements of Kings. Overall time complexity: \(O(4^n m)\)

docs.title: DP on Trees: Maximum Independent Set on Trees
docs.text:
Given an undirected tree \(G(V, E)\), find an independent set with maximum number of vertices.

Independent set here

Independent set \(S\) here meas \(\forall u, v \in S, (u, v) \notin E\), which is aligned with the independent set definition before.

Maximize independent set

It is NP-hard in normal undirected graphs (because Maximum Clique is NP-Hard, and the independent set in \(G(V, E)\) is the clique in \(\overline{G}(V, \overline{E})\))

In a subtree, - If we choose the root, we should decide the problems from 2-deeper subtrees. - If we do not choose the root, we should decide the problems from 1-deeper subtrees.

Let \(H[u]\): the maximized size of independent set of the subtree rooted at \(v\)

\[ H[v] = \max \left\{\sum_{u \in \operatorname{Children}(v)} H[u], 1 + \sum_{u \in \operatorname{GrandChildren}(v)} H[u]\right\} \]

And the recurrence comes from leaves to root.

Analysis

Each vertex is processed once and each \(H[u]\) is looked up for twice: \(O(\vert V \vert)\)

Actually Greedy solution is also correct

To be completed...
